programme.title: Summerland
Summerland
programme.desc:
Summerland: Directed by Jessica Swale. With Gemma Arterton, Gugu Mbatha-Raw, Penelope Wilton, Tom Courtenay. During World War II, an Englishwoman opens her heart to an evacuee after initially resolving to be rid of him in this moving journey of womanhood, love and friendship." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6841122/","name":"Summerland","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2IzNDI4ZjQtMDIwYy00MjcwLThjMTItYzc0ZGVjZThjNzAzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTE1MzI2NzIz._V1_.jpg","description":"During World War II, an Englishwoman opens her heart to an evacuee after initially resolving to be rid of him in this moving journey of womanhood, love and friendship.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6841122/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ferguson-6"},"dateCreated":"2020-07-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"learning from one another","reviewBody":"Greetings again from the darkness. We get our first glimpse of Alice Lamb as an older woman in 1975 pounding away on her Royal typewriter before abruptly and rudely shooing neighborhood kids away from her door. We then flashback thirty-something years to World War II, and find a younger version of Alice still clacking away on the same Royal and still chasing off the local youngsters. Segments with the older Alice bookend the film, but most of our time is spent with the younger Alice in the first feature film from writer-director Jessica Swale, a renowned playwright.

Gemma Arterton (QUANTUM OF SOLACE, 2008) plays younger Alice, a writer and researcher based in the countryside of Kent. She's not just a reclusive writer, but we learn she's holding a grudge against the world ever since she was denied true love while at University. The townspeople view her as antisocial, while the local kids refer to as a witch. When the local school Headmaster (Tom Courtenay) refers to her "stories", she quickly corrects him to "Academic Thesis." It's no wonder she's earned the label, "Beast on the Beach."

During the German Blitz, many London families sent their kids to live with families in the much safer countryside. One day an official brings young Frank (Lucas Bond) to Alice's home for temporary guardianship, and she responds "I don't want him" ... yes, in front of the boy. Frank's father is fighting during the war, while his mother is working with the ministry. Of course, we know that Alice's iceberg of a heart will eventually thaw, and it begins when Frank expresses an interest in the legends and folklore at the center of Alice's research. Of particular interest to Frank is Summerland, the pagan term for afterlife, and the corresponding images.

As an evacuee, Frank is a bit of an outsider at school, but he makes friends with Edie (Dixie Egerickx, THE LITTLE STRANGER, 2018), a spirited young lady who, like most kids, doesn't much trust Alice. It's interesting to watch as Frank and Alice reluctantly grow closer, but this is war time, and joy is sometimes difficult to come by. However, this odd couple seem good for a life lessons to the other.

Penelope Wilton plays the older Alice and Gugu Mbatha-Raw lights up the screen in only a few scenes, and it's Ms. Arterton's best work since TAMARA DREWE (2010). Young Alice experiences visions and memories of a past life not meant to be. The twist is quite obvious, yet no less effective. Ms. Swale's film is sentimental and melodramatic, and probably employs a few too many clichés. Yet, although predictable, it does offer hope; and given the times we are in, a hopeful message is quite welcome - as is the reminder that "stories have to come from somewhere."","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5355,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Drama","Romance","War"],"datePublished":"2020-07-31","keywords":"love,lesbian,world war two,evacuee,lesbianism","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4123967001","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGI5ZGI3NTAtMTA4Ny00MjVhLThiMmYtMTg2M2M5YmZmMjJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGI5ZGI3NTAtMTA4Ny00MjVhLThiMmYtMTg2M2M5YmZmMjJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"During World War II, an Englishwoman "Gemma Arterton" opens her heart to an evacuee after initially resolving to be rid of him in this moving journey of womanhood, love and friendship. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2605345/","name":"Gemma Arterton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1813221/","name":"Gugu Mbatha-Raw"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0934362/","name":"Penelope Wilton"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7328140/","name":"Jessica Swale"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0419532/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0352835/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7328140/","name":"Jessica Swale"}],"duration":"PT1H39M"}</script><metacontent="

A world traveling pianist and her husband have decided not to have a baby, but then he sees a surprise childbirth on a flight and tampers with her pill." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8076110/","name":"Énorme","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjhlZTk2ZWYtMTBhZS00YmMxLTliYmYtNzU4ZjA4NTY4YjI4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjYxNzY5MjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A world traveling pianist and her husband have decided not to have a baby, but then he sees a surprise childbirth on a flight and tampers with her pill.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8076110/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"briefexistance"},"dateCreated":"2021-02-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"The husband = merde","reviewBody":"I can't believe this film was centered on the narcissist, self obsessed, stupid, immature, lame man child. I can't believe everyone in the film gaslights Claire even though she didn't want to be pregnant in the first place!!!! Wow. I thought French were more progressive but I was so wrong. programme.title: Validé
programme.desc: William, Brahim et Sara se rendent à Marseille afin de tourner un clip vidéo avec un des groupes en vogue de la cité phocéenne. Pendant ce temps, Rico et les acolytes de Nasser mettent au point un plan pour perturber le tournage. De son côté, Mastar met tout en oeuvre pour trouver l'argent qu'il doit à Carnage. En outre, les ventes de son dernier album sont décevantes. Il tente néanmoins de négocier une avance sur son prochain album à son producteur.

programme.title: Validé
programme.desc: Sno, Inès et William sont satisfaits des échos du clip réalisé en compagnie d'Alonso à Marseille. Ils mettent au point une stratégie pour lancer tranquillement la carrière de Sara. Pour autant, William cherche à connaître le passé tumultueux de la jeune artiste. Nasser obtient une autorisation de sortie de prison de 48 heures. Brahim retourne dans son ancien quartier afin d'apporter des informations à Mounir sur l'organisation du trafic de drogue.

programme.title: Validé
programme.desc: Sara découvre avec stupeur que Nasser a enlevé leur fils. Elle prévient Sno, William et Brahim. Ils décident de se rendre chez sa soeur à Marseille qui s'occupe des affaires de son frères depuis qu'il est en prison. Sara apprend que Nasser envisage d'emmener clandestinement l'enfant au Maroc. William demande à Mounir de les aider.

programme.title: Les choses qu'on dit, les choses qu'on fait
Les choses qu'on dit, les choses qu'on fait
programme.desc:
Les choses qu'on dit, les choses qu'on fait: Directed by Emmanuel Mouret. With Camélia Jordana, Niels Schneider, Vincent Macaigne, Émilie Dequenne. Waiting for her boyfriend to join her on a country vacation, three months pregnant Daphne bonds with his cousin Maxime, and their shared intimacy brings them closer together into a full fledged love affair." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt12443930/","name":"Les choses qu'on dit, les choses qu'on fait","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmZjYjEzNjAtMTVhNS00ZmY0LWJmMWEtYWNkOWFjYTYwMjUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTAwMzM3NDI3._V1_.jpg","description":"Waiting for her boyfriend to join her on a country vacation, three months pregnant Daphne bonds with his cousin Maxime, and their shared intimacy brings them closer together into a full fledged love affair.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt12443930/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"danybur"},"dateCreated":"2021-07-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"The human comedy (and Mozartian)","reviewBody":"Summary

Over two hours, Emmanuel Mouret (director and screenwriter) unfolds this admirable human comedy (in the Balzacian sense) of intertwined stories, with the motives of his characters centered on desire and love and the delicate balance between what They tell each other, what they do, what they feel, what they show (us), the tacit or explicit agreements and the imponderable. And he does it using different tones and genres and supported by extraordinary performances.

Review:

Maxime goes to a country house to spend a few days with his cousin Francois and Daphné, his partner. But Francois had to leave before his arrival and Maxime and Daphné will spend a few days alone chatting and revealing their respective sentimental stories.

Emmanuel Mouret (director and guinosta) achieves an admirable mosaic of intertwined stories. In the first place, there are two main stories, with their respective points of view: Daphné's and Maxime's, each developed with a different tone, with some voice-over introducing or commenting on the flashbacks that alternate. On the other hand, there is the present time, where the point of view is that of the spectator. Then other moments with other points of view will be added.

The inventory of situations is overwhelming, exposed without haste and without pause, with flirtations, friendships, courtships, couples, marriages and infidelities, always highlighting the difference between "what is said and what is done", to what I I would add "what it feels like."

And yes: it is a French film with a literary imprint where the characters talk a lot about what happens to them, but where they are also silent as much. The style of the story refers to various cinematographies, depending on which story and characters it is and at what point in the story we find ourselves: at times it seems like a Rohmer film and at others a very subtle humor close to Woody Allen appears, for example. Different tones of comedy (tangled, romantic, sentimental), melodrama and drama are combined, with extraordinary use of a soundtrack with classical music ranging from Purcell and Haydn to Poulenc. In this way, the sequence of scenes could also be assimilated to a series of recitatives and arias from a Mozart opera. But beyond the references and influences, the result is absolutely personal.

Far from causing dispersion, the script solidly interweaves the stories, sheds new light in their recesses and the dramatic crescendo is incessant, reaching an extremely emotional climax.

Within a solid cast, Niels Schneider stands out as Maxime, a timid aspiring writer (in the antipodes of the manipulative Philippe who played in An Impossible Love or the Object of Desire in Dolan's Imaginary Loves), Camélia Jordana who brings all her expressiveness to Daphné, a film editor, Vincent Macaigne as the endearing Francois, Daphne's partner and Émilie Dequenne's Louise, with all her surprising edges.

In sum, over the course of two hours, Mouret unfolds this remarkable human comedy in the Balzacian sense, with the motives of his characters centered on desire and love and the delicate balance between what they say to each other, what they do, what they feel, what (to us and is) shown and hidden, seduction games, tacit or explicit agreements, renunciations, confusion, the imponderable.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1582,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2020-09-16","keywords":"paris france,cannes 2020,pregnant woman,countryside,flashback","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [VOST]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1976156441","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTczNTJiNTctOWJjYi00NDcxLTlkMmUtNGVjOTQ1ZDgzZTg0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTczNTJiNTctOWJjYi00NDcxLTlkMmUtNGVjOTQ1ZDgzZTg0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3874127/","name":"Camélia Jordana"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2671105/","name":"Niels Schneider"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0531195/","name":"Vincent Macaigne"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0609981/","name":"Emmanuel Mouret"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028557/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0090290/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0346444/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0609981/","name":"Emmanuel Mouret"}],"duration":"PT2H2M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 12443930, Title: Les choses qu'on dit, les choses qu'on fait, --- Description: Les choses qu'on dit, les choses qu'on fait: Directed by Emmanuel Mouret. Waiting for her boyfriend to join her on a country vacation, three months pregnant Daphne bonds with his cousin Maxime, and their shared intimacy brings them closer together into a full fledged love affair." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt12443930/","name":"Les choses qu'on dit, les choses qu'on fait","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmZjYjEzNjAtMTVhNS00ZmY0LWJmMWEtYWNkOWFjYTYwMjUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTAwMzM3NDI3._V1_.jpg","description":"Waiting for her boyfriend to join her on a country vacation, three months pregnant Daphne bonds with his cousin Maxime, and their shared intimacy brings them closer together into a full fledged love affair.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt12443930/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"danybur","dateCreated":"2021-07-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"The human comedy (and Mozartian)","reviewBody":"Summary

Over two hours, Emmanuel Mouret (director and screenwriter) unfolds this admirable human comedy (in the Balzacian sense) of intertwined stories, with the motives of his characters centered on desire and love and the delicate balance between what They tell each other, what they do, what they feel, what they show (us), the tacit or explicit agreements and the imponderable. And he does it using different tones and genres and supported by extraordinary performances.

Review:

Maxime goes to a country house to spend a few days with his cousin Francois and Daphné, his partner. But Francois had to leave before his arrival and Maxime and Daphné will spend a few days alone chatting and revealing their respective sentimental stories.

Emmanuel Mouret (director and guinosta) achieves an admirable mosaic of intertwined stories. In the first place, there are two main stories, with their respective points of view: Daphné's and Maxime's, each developed with a different tone, with some voice-over introducing or commenting on the flashbacks that alternate. On the other hand, there is the present time, where the point of view is that of the spectator. Then other moments with other points of view will be added.

The inventory of situations is overwhelming, exposed without haste and without pause, with flirtations, friendships, courtships, couples, marriages and infidelities, always highlighting the difference between "what is said and what is done", to what I I would add "what it feels like."

And yes: it is a French film with a literary imprint where the characters talk a lot about what happens to them, but where they are also silent as much. The style of the story refers to various cinematographies, depending on which story and characters it is and at what point in the story we find ourselves: at times it seems like a Rohmer film and at others a very subtle humor close to Woody Allen appears, for example. Different tones of comedy (tangled, romantic, sentimental), melodrama and drama are combined, with extraordinary use of a soundtrack with classical music ranging from Purcell and Haydn to Poulenc. In this way, the sequence of scenes could also be assimilated to a series of recitatives and arias from a Mozart opera. But beyond the references and influences, the result is absolutely personal.

Far from causing dispersion, the script solidly interweaves the stories, sheds new light in their recesses and the dramatic crescendo is incessant, reaching an extremely emotional climax.

Within a solid cast, Niels Schneider stands out as Maxime, a timid aspiring writer (in the antipodes of the manipulative Philippe who played in An Impossible Love or the Object of Desire in Dolan's Imaginary Loves), Camélia Jordana who brings all her expressiveness to Daphné, a film editor, Vincent Macaigne as the endearing Francois, Daphne's partner and Émilie Dequenne's Louise, with all her surprising edges.

In sum, over the course of two hours, Mouret unfolds this remarkable human comedy in the Balzacian sense, with the motives of his characters centered on desire and love and the delicate balance between what they say to each other, what they do, what they feel, what (to us and is) shown and hidden, seduction games, tacit or explicit agreements, renunciations, confusion, the imponderable.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1582,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7,"genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2020-09-16","keywords":"paris france,cannes 2020,pregnant woman,countryside,flashback","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [VOST]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1976156441","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTczNTJiNTctOWJjYi00NDcxLTlkMmUtNGVjOTQ1ZDgzZTg0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTczNTJiNTctOWJjYi00NDcxLTlkMmUtNGVjOTQ1ZDgzZTg0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3874127/","name":"Camélia Jordana","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2671105/","name":"Niels Schneider","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0531195/","name":"Vincent Macaigne"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0609981/","name":"Emmanuel Mouret"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028557/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0090290/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0346444/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0609981/","name":"Emmanuel Mouret"],"duration":"PT2H2M"</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 12443930, Title: Les choses qu'on dit, les choses qu'on fait, --- Description: Les choses qu'on dit, les choses qu'on fait: Directed by Emmanuel Mouret. With Camélia Jordana, Niels Schneider, Vincent Macaigne, Émilie Dequenne. Waiting for her boyfriend to join her on a country vacation, three months pregnant Daphne bonds with his cousin Maxime, and their shared intimacy brings them closer together into a full fledged love affair." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt12443930/","name":"Les choses qu'on dit, les choses qu'on fait","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmZjYjEzNjAtMTVhNS00ZmY0LWJmMWEtYWNkOWFjYTYwMjUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTAwMzM3NDI3._V1_.jpg","description":"Waiting for her boyfriend to join her on a country vacation, three months pregnant Daphne bonds with his cousin Maxime, and their shared intimacy brings them closer together into a full fledged love affair.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt12443930/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"danybur","dateCreated":"2021-07-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"The human comedy (and Mozartian)","reviewBody":"Summary

Over two hours, Emmanuel Mouret (director and screenwriter) unfolds this admirable human comedy (in the Balzacian sense) of intertwined stories, with the motives of his characters centered on desire and love and the delicate balance between what They tell each other, what they do, what they feel, what they show (us), the tacit or explicit agreements and the imponderable. And he does it using different tones and genres and supported by extraordinary performances.

Review:

Maxime goes to a country house to spend a few days with his cousin Francois and Daphné, his partner. But Francois had to leave before his arrival and Maxime and Daphné will spend a few days alone chatting and revealing their respective sentimental stories.

Emmanuel Mouret (director and guinosta) achieves an admirable mosaic of intertwined stories. In the first place, there are two main stories, with their respective points of view: Daphné's and Maxime's, each developed with a different tone, with some voice-over introducing or commenting on the flashbacks that alternate. On the other hand, there is the present time, where the point of view is that of the spectator. Then other moments with other points of view will be added.

The inventory of situations is overwhelming, exposed without haste and without pause, with flirtations, friendships, courtships, couples, marriages and infidelities, always highlighting the difference between "what is said and what is done", to what I I would add "what it feels like."

And yes: it is a French film with a literary imprint where the characters talk a lot about what happens to them, but where they are also silent as much. The style of the story refers to various cinematographies, depending on which story and characters it is and at what point in the story we find ourselves: at times it seems like a Rohmer film and at others a very subtle humor close to Woody Allen appears, for example. Different tones of comedy (tangled, romantic, sentimental), melodrama and drama are combined, with extraordinary use of a soundtrack with classical music ranging from Purcell and Haydn to Poulenc. In this way, the sequence of scenes could also be assimilated to a series of recitatives and arias from a Mozart opera. But beyond the references and influences, the result is absolutely personal.

Far from causing dispersion, the script solidly interweaves the stories, sheds new light in their recesses and the dramatic crescendo is incessant, reaching an extremely emotional climax.

Within a solid cast, Niels Schneider stands out as Maxime, a timid aspiring writer (in the antipodes of the manipulative Philippe who played in An Impossible Love or the Object of Desire in Dolan's Imaginary Loves), Camélia Jordana who brings all her expressiveness to Daphné, a film editor, Vincent Macaigne as the endearing Francois, Daphne's partner and Émilie Dequenne's Louise, with all her surprising edges.

In sum, over the course of two hours, Mouret unfolds this remarkable human comedy in the Balzacian sense, with the motives of his characters centered on desire and love and the delicate balance between what they say to each other, what they do, what they feel, what (to us and is) shown and hidden, seduction games, tacit or explicit agreements, renunciations, confusion, the imponderable.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1582,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7,"genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2020-09-16","keywords":"paris france,cannes 2020,pregnant woman,countryside,flashback","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [VOST]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1976156441","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTczNTJiNTctOWJjYi00NDcxLTlkMmUtNGVjOTQ1ZDgzZTg0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTczNTJiNTctOWJjYi00NDcxLTlkMmUtNGVjOTQ1ZDgzZTg0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3874127/","name":"Camélia Jordana","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2671105/","name":"Niels Schneider","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0531195/","name":"Vincent Macaigne"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0609981/","name":"Emmanuel Mouret"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028557/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0090290/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0346444/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0609981/","name":"Emmanuel Mouret"],"duration":"PT2H2M"</script><metacontent="

A remake of the 2014 Danish film 'Silent Heart'." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8717446/","name":"Blackbird","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDk1OTQ5MjAtNzM5Ny00YTFhLWJiNzYtMjZhNWZmMGU0M2YwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDExMzMxNjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A terminally ill mother arranges to bring her family together one last time before she dies. A remake of the 2014 Danish film 'Silent Heart'.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8717446/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"elishawin2005"},"dateCreated":"2020-12-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Coulda, woulda, shoulda...been better","reviewBody":"Do you remember Susan Sarandon in the movie Stepmom with Julia Roberts? After all these years I still tear up during certain scenes. That never happened here. Not even almost! I actually think I dosed off for a minute somewhere in the middle of it. It felt like they just had to fill in some open space just to finally get to the departure. I wouldn't watch it again and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone else.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3741,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-09-18","keywords":"euthanasia,family gathering,terminal illness,assisted suicide,remake","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi912113177","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWI3MGQyYTEtOTI2MS00MTg5LTk0MTItMDlkMjMyOGYzMDZlXkEyXkFqcGdeQWRvb2xpbmhk._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWI3MGQyYTEtOTI2MS00MTg5LTk0MTItMDlkMjMyOGYzMDZlXkEyXkFqcGdeQWRvb2xpbmhk._V1_.jpg","description":"Lily (Susan Sarandon) and Paul (Sam Neill) summon their loved ones to their beach house for one final gathering after Lily decides to end her long lbattle with ALS. The couple is planning a loving weekend complete with holiday traditions, but the mood becomes strained when unresolved issues surface between Lily and her daughters Jennifer (Kate Winslet) and Anna (Mia Wasikowska). Joining the collective farewell are Lily’s son in law (Rainn Wilson), her lifelong friend (Lindsay Duncan), daughter’s partner (Bex Taylor-Klaus) and grandson (Anson Boon). Her story is ultimately one of hope, love and a celebration of life."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000554/","name":"Sam Neill"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000215/","name":"Susan Sarandon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6978918/","name":"Anson Boon"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0585011/","name":"Roger Michell"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0403784/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0147213/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0646497/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1311535/","name":"Christian Torpe"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Un conte peut en cacher un autre
programme.desc: Et si chaque nuit, Jack, celui du conte au haricot magique, rêvait de Cendrillon ? Et si le Petit Chaperon rouge était la meilleure amie de Blanche-Neige ? Et si cette dernière était blonde ? Et si le loup ne croquait plus le petit cochon ? C'est que laisse supposer le loup qui se retrouve face à une baby-sitter nourrie aux contes de fées. Le loup s'empresse de lui raconter sa version de ses histoires, en omettant de dire qu'il a un passif avec Blanche-Neige et le Petit Chaperon (il a voulu en faire son dîner et qu'elle s'est bien défendue)...
programme.category: Téléfilm d'animation

programme.title: Judas and the Black Messiah
Judas and the Black Messiah
programme.desc:
Judas and the Black Messiah: Directed by Shaka King. With Daniel Kaluuya, LaKeith Stanfield, Jesse Plemons, Dominique Fishback. Offered a plea deal by the FBI, William O'Neal infiltrates the Illinois chapter of the Black Panther Party to gather intelligence on Chairman Fred Hampton." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9784798/","name":"Judas and the Black Messiah","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjBjYjBjNTUtOTg0Ni00Yzk2LTg1NWMtNjI2ODk2YjJmZGU0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODE5NzE3OTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Offered a plea deal by the FBI, William O'Neal infiltrates the Illinois chapter of the Black Panther Party to gather intelligence on Chairman Fred Hampton.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9784798/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"drednm"},"dateCreated":"2021-03-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Long, Slow and Dull","reviewBody":"While the acting is good, the deadly pacing kills the drama in this historical look at the Black Panthers and the FBI snitch who helped set up a series of police raids that led to many deaths.

Martin Sheen injects some life into the proceedings as creepy J. Edgar Hoover, but Jesse Plemons is like walking death as the FBI agent who coerces Bill O'Neal (LaKeith Stanfield) into being a rat.

Daniel Kaluuya practically speaks in tongues and I could decipher only about half of what he said as Fred Hampton, the target of the FBI raids in Chicago's branch of the Panthers.

Violent but not very interesting."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":62183,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Drama","History"],"datePublished":"2021-02-12","keywords":"black panther party,fbi federal bureau of investigation,reference to malcolm x,u.s. politics,1960s","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi554680601","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzI3NGZlM2UtYWFmYi00NTViLTgyYjUtY2ExN2YxNGNmMTUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQWRvb2xpbmhk._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzI3NGZlM2UtYWFmYi00NTViLTgyYjUtY2ExN2YxNGNmMTUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQWRvb2xpbmhk._V1_.jpg","description":"FBI informant William O’Neal (LaKeith Stanfield) infiltrates the Illinois Black Panther Party and is tasked with keeping tabs on their charismatic leader, Chairman Fred Hampton (Daniel Kaluuya). A career thief, O’Neal revels in the danger of manipulating both his comrades and his handler, Special Agent Roy Mitchell (Jesse Plemons). Hampton’s political prowess grows just as he’s falling in love with fellow revolutionary Deborah Johnson (Dominique Fishback). Meanwhile, a battle wages for O’Neal’s soul. Will he align with the forces of good? Or subdue Hampton and The Panthers by any means, as FBI Director J. Edgar Hoover (Martin Sheen) commands?"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2257207/","name":"Daniel Kaluuya"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3147751/","name":"LaKeith Stanfield"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0687146/","name":"Jesse Plemons"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3489851/","name":"Shaka King"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0309252/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0609239/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0515595/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0077768/","name":"Will Berson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3489851/","name":"Shaka King"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3584219/","name":"Kenneth Lucas"}],"duration":"PT2H6M"}</script><metacontent="

A man takes a job offer, soon learning about their unorthodox rules and routines." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt10768238/","name":"Partisan","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjhkNWUzZjEtYWM2NS00MjE1LWEwM2MtMDUwYWVlYjE3MDQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDY5Njc2NDQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Set in the idyllic surroundings of Jordnära, a gated community that runs a very successful organic farm. programme.title: The New Mutants
Les Nouveaux Mutants
programme.desc:
The New Mutants: Directed by Josh Boone. With Maisie Williams, Anya Taylor-Joy, Charlie Heaton, Alice Braga. Five young mutants, just discovering their abilities while held in a secret facility against their will, fight to escape their past sins and save themselves." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4682266/","name":"The New Mutants","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDQ2NTdmNDgtMGIwMS00ODE2LTk5M2EtZGZhYzc4MWRlNTU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTc4MjczMTM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Five young mutants, just discovering their abilities while held in a secret facility against their will, fight to escape their past sins and save themselves.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4682266/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"user-46-247014"},"dateCreated":"2021-01-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Bad Writing","reviewBody":"No amount of acting and effects can make up for terrible writing. Lets just say they set up certain things in the movie and then never use them. You're like, oh the beginning of the movie said this, but don't expect anything to happen because... bad writing.

It really peaks near the beginning, then really drags on. Theres a fight scene near the end that is endless, unbelievable, really repetitive. The climax is anticlimactic so....

There was potential for a good movie, and the actors did fine, but the characters didn't act like real people. It was so obvious what was going on but they dragged on every single story element and repeated it. I feel bad for these actors; Truly a waste of money and talent.

Part of the reason it was so bad is because it has an intellectual level of Spy Kids, super predictable and stereotypical moments but placed and set up so poorly that they have no emotional depth. It checks all the boxes except being interesting and having a good plot... you know... like missing the whole point of movies.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":67203,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.3},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Horror","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2020-08-28","keywords":"mutant,based on comic book,marvel comics,x men,superheroine","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Comic-Con Teaser","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1041219097","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmIyNDQxZDgtNTY0NS00ZDcxLTkwNDgtYjQ1ZGI0NGU2ODcxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXNuZXNodQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmIyNDQxZDgtNTY0NS00ZDcxLTkwNDgtYjQ1ZGI0NGU2ODcxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXNuZXNodQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Twentieth Century Studios in association with Marvel Entertainment presents The New Mutants, an original horror thriller set in an isolated hospital where a group of young mutants is being held for psychiatric monitoring. When strange occurrences begin to take place, both their new mutant abilities and their friendships will be tested as they battle to try and make it out alive. Directed by Josh Boone (The Fault in our Stars) and written by Josh Boone & Knate Lee, The New Mutants stars: Maisie Williams (Game of Thrones); Anya Taylor-Joy (Glass); Charlie Heaton (Stranger Things); Alice Braga (Predators); Blu Hunt (The Originals); and Henry Zaga (13 Reasons Why). The film is produced by Simon Kinberg, p.g.a., Karen Rosenfelt and Lauren Shuler Donner with Stan Lee and Michele Imperato Stabile serving as executive producers."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3586035/","name":"Maisie Williams"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5896355/","name":"Anya Taylor-Joy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6390427/","name":"Charlie Heaton"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1837748/","name":"Josh Boone"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0781821/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0566686/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047120/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1837748/","name":"Josh Boone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1029878/","name":"Knate Lee"}],"duration":"PT1H34M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.review: IMDb data; ttnr: 0388644, Title: Soupçons, --- Description: Soupçons: With Michael Peterson, David Rudolf, Ron Guerette, Martha Ratliff. The high-profile murder trial of American novelist Michael Peterson following the death of his wife in 2001." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0388644/","name":"Soupçons","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTU4NTE3MDY4NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODk4NjY1NTM@._V1_.jpg","description":"The high-profile murder trial of American novelist Michael Peterson following the death of his wife in 2001.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0388644/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"smcgilli-2","dateCreated":"2018-06-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Interesting story but horrible editing","reviewBody":"I wont go over the whole story here as many other have already done so. Yes, this is a tragic story and has some interesting twists. Yes, I feel that justice was not well served for this whole investigation and trial. However, this 13 episode series could have easily been edited down to 6 or 7 episodes. There is SO much fluff. There are SO many scenes that drag on or rehash the same info. The characters are just not that interesting to hear them go on and on. They even have drawn out scenes of cars parking or driving away or people walking...nothing going on. No drama. No storytelling. No point. It makes a slow story feel a LOT slower.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":20731,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.9,"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Documentary","Crime","Drama"],"keywords":"columnist,blowpoke,true crime,blood,staircase","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2023399/","name":"Michael Peterson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5308683/","name":"David Rudolf","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5509614/","name":"Ron Guerette"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0070801/"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Staircase - Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2745482009","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWJlZTMyYTktYjA0Mi00ODRiLThkMzQtMmNkM2JmNjI0OTI1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRzdGFzaWVr._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWJlZTMyYTktYjA0Mi00ODRiLThkMzQtMmNkM2JmNjI0OTI1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRzdGFzaWVr._V1_.jpg","description":"The compelling story of Michael Peterson, a crime novelist accused of killing wife Kathleen after she is found dead at the bottom of a staircase in their home."</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Il generale Della Rovere
Le général Della Rovere
programme.desc:
Il generale Della Rovere: Directed by Roberto Rossellini. With Vittorio De Sica, Hannes Messemer, Vittorio Caprioli, Nando Angelini. Bardone, a petty con man, is arrested by the Gestapo and coerced into impersonating a partisan leader in order to expose another resistance organizer." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0053856/","name":"Il generale Della Rovere","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDQ1MDJjYjUtNjk0Yy00YjRiLThmN2MtZjZkZjE0MTNlOGMwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxMTY0OTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Bardone, a petty con man, is arrested by the Gestapo and coerced into impersonating a partisan leader in order to expose another resistance organizer.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0053856/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ma-cortes"},"dateCreated":"2021-05-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"A very acclaimed movie featuring a top-notch acting by veteran actor/director Vittorio De Sica","reviewBody":"Concerning a WWII marketeer and swindler called Bardone : Vittorio De Sica , he often uses to disguise as an officer to get money from the the families of people put in prison by the Gestapo . Once trapped , the Nazis make a deal with him . Then he is forced by a Nazi Colonel Muller : Hannes Messerner to go undercover in a local jail. To find out who the resistance leader is , he poses as a General called Della Rovere . But when the inmates start looking him for guidance , it leads to tragic consequences . He's a Hero...or a Fake ?

This General Della la Rovere 1969 magnificently played by Vittorio De Sica as a petty con man deals with the fantastic wartime adventures and intrigues of the mountebank who held the fate of the fighting undergroung in his hands . Eventually , our hero finds the line between his assumed character and actual identity diminished , awakening his slumbering conscience, resulting in a dramatic conclusion . It contains an interesting and thought-provoking screenplay from Indro Montanelli , Sergio Amadei , Fabbri and Roberto Rossellini himself . Starring Vittorio De Sica is well accompanied by a good cast , such as : Hannes Messemer , Sandra Milo , Anne Vernon , Vittorio Caprioli , Giovanna Ralli , Franco Interlenghi , Linda Veras, Modugno, Luciano Pigozi or Allan Collins , among others.

There is another inferior version 2011 directed by Carlo Carlei starrred by Pierfrancesco Faviano and Shopov . Il Generale Della Rovere 1959 displays an evocative cinematography in black and white by Carlo Cardini . As well as atmospheric and sensitive musical score by Renzo Rossellini . The motion picture was stunningly directed by Roberto Rosselini . He was a prestigious writer and director, making notorious films, such as : "Paisan" , "The Miracle" , "Amore" , "Stromboli" , "The Flowers of St Francis" , "Europe" , " Voyage in Italy" , "Seven Deadly Sins" , "Blas Pascal", "The Rise of Louis XIV" , "Agustín of Hippo" , "The Messiah" , among others . Rating : 7.5/10. Above average, well worth seeing . Especially recommended for featuring a bravura lead interpretation by veteran Vittorio De Sica .","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3117,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","War"],"datePublished":"1959-11-11","keywords":"resistance,nazi,gestapo,swindler,con man","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001120/","name":"Vittorio De Sica"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0582019/","name":"Hannes Messemer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0590452/","name":"Sandra Milo"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0744023/","name":"Roberto Rossellini"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040085/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0051263/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0024847/","name":"Sergio Amidei"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0264420/","name":"Diego Fabbri"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0598975/","name":"Indro Montanelli"}],"duration":"PT2H12M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Volpone
Volpone
programme.desc: Volpone: Directed by Maurice Tourneur, Jacques de Baroncelli. With Harry Baur, Louis Jouvet, Charles Dullin, Jean Témerson. Volpone, an elderly Venetian, connives with his money-crazed servant to convince his greedy friends that he is dying, knowing that each will try to curry favor with him in order to be named his heir. He is inundated with valuable gifts, and soon finds himself entangled deeper and deeper in a web of lies." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0033229/","name":"Volpone","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTQzZjNhMTYtZDJkZi00MDljLWE4NjUtYzZkODA3ZTc1OWI1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDI3OTIzOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Volpone, an elderly Venetian, connives with his money-crazed servant to convince his greedy friends that he is dying, knowing that each will try to curry favor with him in order to be named his heir. He is inundated with valuable gif","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0033229/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Cineanalyst"},"dateCreated":"2005-06-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"How Time Changes","reviewBody":"The print I saw was of very poor quality, but that doesn't appear to matter. This is a filmed play, with totally uninteresting cinematography. The idea of actors acting, with all the pranks and scheming is promising, but not here. This isn't funny. If there was supposed to be some satire, it is lost.\n\nI suppose it is not uncommon, but this film, "Volpone", directed by Maurice Tourneur bares no resemblance to the films of his made three or so decades ago. In the 1910s into the 1920s, Tourneur was a pioneer the new art form in the states. His films were interestingly photographed for the times. "The Wishing Ring: An Idyll of Old England" (1914) referenced theatre, but in a rather cinematic way. "Volpone" is just one of the films he made in France, but it seems antagonistic to a filmmaker who was forging an identity for cinema more independent of theatre.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":2}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":368,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"1941-05-10","keywords":"foreign language adaptation,theater,based on play","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0062428/","name":"Harry Baur"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0431212/","name":"Louis Jouvet"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0241348/","name":"Charles Dullin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0869665/","name":"Maurice Tourneur"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0056334/","name":"Jacques de Baroncelli"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142344/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0429627/","name":"Ben Jonson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0738653/","name":"Jules Romains"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0959003/","name":"Stefan Zweig"}],"duration":"PT1H34M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: La tête d'un homme
La tête d'un homme
programme.desc:
La tête d'un homme: Directed by Julien Duvivier. With Harry Baur, Valéry Inkijinoff, Gina Manès, Alexandre Rignault. Willy is broke and his mistress always wants more money. A stranger in a pub agrees to murder his aunt, but everything will not go as planned. Maigret will try to separate fact and fiction." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0024710/","name":"La tête d'un homme","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTEwNTNjZmQtOTYzNS00MDUxLTk3MGMtOGY2ZGRhYjNkZDJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzg1ODEwNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Willy is broke and his mistress always wants more money. A stranger in a pub agrees to murder his aunt, but everything will not go as planned. Maigret will try to separate fact and fiction.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0024710/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"brogmiller"},"dateCreated":"2021-01-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Life doesn't care.","reviewBody":"Prolific Belgian novelist Georges Simenon introduced Inspector Jules Maigret to the world in 1931. Film makers were quick to spot the potential but Simenon was deeply disappointed with the first two adaptations, one of which, 'Nuit au Carrefour' was directed by Jean Renoir with his brother Pierre as Maigret. Simenon was perfectly happy for Renoir to reprise the role in the proposed film of his 'Battle of Nerves' but Simenon himself wanted to direct! Unsurpisingly this idea was knocked on the head. Simenon and Renoir were out and in came Julien Duvivier and Harry Baur who had already made three films together. The title was changed to 'A Man's Head.'

From the opening shot of Madame la Guillotine one is gripped. Duvivier has used this story as a means of conveying his bleak view of the human condition. No adaptation of Maigret, to my knowledge, has succeeded so well in capturing the seediness of demi-monde Montmartre where morally ambiguous characters exist as best they can. This is Film Noir in all but name. The director is aided in this by the art direction of Georges Wakhevitch, for some reason 'uncredited' and his preferred cinematographer at the time Armand Thirard. There is also an inspired use of the voice of chanteuse Damia whose songs are redolent of loss.

Some have criticised the film for making the Maigret of Harry Baur a secondary character to the murderer Radek of Valery Inkijinoff. This is however reminiscent of the relationship between Inspector Porfiry Petrovich and Raskolnikov in 'Crime and Punishment' and is just as effective. As in Dostoevsky's masterpiece all that Maigret has to do is to bide his time and give Radek enough rope. Ironically Bauer was to play Porfiry for Pierre Chenal in 1935.

Inkijinoff excels in the challenging and psychologically complex role of a man under sentence of death from Tuberculosis who has nothing to lose by killing for money and then blackmailing the man who hired him. His one grip on life comes in the shape of his unrequited passion for the Edna of Gina Manes. After a while however his character becomes rather tiresome and one longs for him to be put out of his misery. Mlle Manes, although not a conventional beauty, has sexual charisma in spades and Duvivier has made wonderful use of her eyes, by turns seductive and cunning.

There are two masters at work here. Duvivier, a master of film-making and Bauer, a master of film acting. French cinema has always been more about character than plot and here director and cast are in their element.

Heaven only knows what Simenon thought of the remake 'Man on the Eiffel Tower' but by then he was probably too rich to care. The film lacks a strong hand at the helm and Charles Laughton's idiosyncratic performance as Maigret lacks depth.

Apparently, for reasons best known to himself, Simenon's personal preference in the role was for Rupert Davies!!!!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":574,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"genre":["Crime","Mystery","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1933-02-18","keywords":"paris france,inheritance,shoe print,chalkline of body,1930s","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0062428/","name":"Harry Baur"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0409105/","name":"Valéry Inkijinoff"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0544539/","name":"Gina Manès"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0245213/","name":"Julien Duvivier"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0147182/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0799442/","name":"Georges Simenon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0216457/","name":"Louis Delaprée"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0130619/","name":"Pierre Calmann"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0024710, Title: La tête d'un homme, --- Description: La tête d'un homme: Directed by Julien Duvivier. With Harry Baur, Valéry Inkijinoff, Gina Manès, Alexandre Rignault. Willy is broke and his mistress always wants more money. A stranger in a pub agrees to murder his aunt, but everything will not go as planned. Maigret will try to separate fact and fiction." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0024710/","name":"La tête d'un homme","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTEwNTNjZmQtOTYzNS00MDUxLTk3MGMtOGY2ZGRhYjNkZDJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzg1ODEwNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Willy is broke and his mistress always wants more money. A stranger in a pub agrees to murder his aunt, but everything will not go as planned. Maigret will try to separate fact and fiction.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0024710/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"brogmiller","dateCreated":"2021-01-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Life doesn't care.","reviewBody":"Prolific Belgian novelist Georges Simenon introduced Inspector Jules Maigret to the world in 1931. Film makers were quick to spot the potential but Simenon was deeply disappointed with the first two adaptations, one of which, 'Nuit au Carrefour' was directed by Jean Renoir with his brother Pierre as Maigret. Simenon was perfectly happy for Renoir to reprise the role in the proposed film of his 'Battle of Nerves' but Simenon himself wanted to direct! Unsurpisingly this idea was knocked on the head. Simenon and Renoir were out and in came Julien Duvivier and Harry Baur who had already made three films together. The title was changed to 'A Man's Head.'

From the opening shot of Madame la Guillotine one is gripped. Duvivier has used this story as a means of conveying his bleak view of the human condition. No adaptation of Maigret, to my knowledge, has succeeded so well in capturing the seediness of demi-monde Montmartre where morally ambiguous characters exist as best they can. This is Film Noir in all but name. The director is aided in this by the art direction of Georges Wakhevitch, for some reason 'uncredited' and his preferred cinematographer at the time Armand Thirard. There is also an inspired use of the voice of chanteuse Damia whose songs are redolent of loss.

Some have criticised the film for making the Maigret of Harry Baur a secondary character to the murderer Radek of Valery Inkijinoff. This is however reminiscent of the relationship between Inspector Porfiry Petrovich and Raskolnikov in 'Crime and Punishment' and is just as effective. As in Dostoevsky's masterpiece all that Maigret has to do is to bide his time and give Radek enough rope. Ironically Bauer was to play Porfiry for Pierre Chenal in 1935.

Inkijinoff excels in the challenging and psychologically complex role of a man under sentence of death from Tuberculosis who has nothing to lose by killing for money and then blackmailing the man who hired him. His one grip on life comes in the shape of his unrequited passion for the Edna of Gina Manes. After a while however his character becomes rather tiresome and one longs for him to be put out of his misery. Mlle Manes, although not a conventional beauty, has sexual charisma in spades and Duvivier has made wonderful use of her eyes, by turns seductive and cunning.

There are two masters at work here. Duvivier, a master of film-making and Bauer, a master of film acting. French cinema has always been more about character than plot and here director and cast are in their element.

Heaven only knows what Simenon thought of the remake 'Man on the Eiffel Tower' but by then he was probably too rich to care. The film lacks a strong hand at the helm and Charles Laughton's idiosyncratic performance as Maigret lacks depth.

Apparently, for reasons best known to himself, Simenon's personal preference in the role was for Rupert Davies!!!!","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":574,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1,"genre":["Crime","Mystery","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1933-02-18","keywords":"paris france,inheritance,shoe print,chalkline of body,1930s","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0062428/","name":"Harry Baur","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0409105/","name":"Valéry Inkijinoff","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0544539/","name":"Gina Manès"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0245213/","name":"Julien Duvivier"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0147182/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0799442/","name":"Georges Simenon","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0216457/","name":"Louis Delaprée","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0130619/","name":"Pierre Calmann"],"duration":"PT1H30M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Canterville Ghost
Le fantôme de Canterville
programme.desc: The Canterville Ghost: Directed by Jules Dassin, Norman Z. McLeod. With Charles Laughton, Robert Young, Margaret O'Brien, William Gargan. The descendent of a ghost imprisoned for cowardice hopes to free the spirit by displaying courage when under duress." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0036696/","name":"The Canterville Ghost","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTRjYjFkNWEtZWIzMS00ZjBiLTgxOWMtZDc0MTJlOTM3YzZjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDUyOTUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The descendent of a ghost imprisoned for cowardice hopes to free the spirit by displaying courage when under duress.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0036696/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"utgard14"},"dateCreated":"2014-01-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"A long time to go without sleep","reviewBody":"The ghost of cowardly Sir Simon de Canterville (Charles Laughton) is cursed to haunt an English castle until one of his descendants performs an act of bravery. It's World War II and his current descendant, six year-old Jessica (Margaret O'Brien) has opened the castle up to American soldiers. One of those soldiers (Robert Young) turns out to be a long-lost descendant of de Canterville. Now all he has to do is perform an act of bravery and the ghost will be freed.\n\nNice family-friendly movie with MGM gloss and quality production. Laughton has a great time and it shows. O'Brien is charming and precocious. Young is solid and likable. A fun movie that should please all but the most miserable among us.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2846,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"Passed","genre":["Comedy","Fantasy"],"keywords":"army private,aunt niece relationship,bomb explosion,boogie woogie dancing,entombed alive","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Canterville Ghost","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3208625945","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmM3YWI5ZTMtYzJmZS00ZmVlLTgxNGUtM2YxOWFhNDI1M2RkXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmM3YWI5ZTMtYzJmZS00ZmVlLTgxNGUtM2YxOWFhNDI1M2RkXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001452/","name":"Charles Laughton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001870/","name":"Robert Young"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0639684/","name":"Margaret O'Brien"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0202088/","name":"Jules Dassin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0572851/","name":"Norman Z. programme.title: Tarzan, le mythe de la jungle
programme.desc: Né d'un récit écrit en 1912 par Edgar Rice Burroughs, qui ne comptait pas lui donner une suite, l'histoire de ce petit garçon élevé parmi les singes va être le moteur d'une incroyable success-story. Romans, bandes dessinées et enfin cinéma popularisent le personnage et le font entrer dans l'imaginaire collectif. Professeur de littérature, historien, ethnologues décryptent le mythe.
programme.category: Cinéma

programme.title: The McConnell Story
Le tigre du ciel
programme.desc: The McConnell Story: Directed by Gordon Douglas. With Alan Ladd, June Allyson, James Whitmore, Frank Faylen. A Korean War fighter pilot hero returns home to test fly the new Sabre jets despite his wife's uneasiness regarding his job." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0048364/","name":"The McConnell Story","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2MzMyOTI2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDA2NDMyMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A Korean War fighter pilot hero returns home to test fly the new Sabre jets despite his wife's uneasiness regarding his job.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0048364/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"SnoopyStyle"},"dateCreated":"2021-09-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"flat ground story with some flying footage","reviewBody":"It's WWII. Army private Joseph "Mac" McConnell, Jr. (Alan Ladd) goes AWOL to learn to fly and escapes from the MPs. He gets a ride from teenager Bob Brown and falls for Bob's sister Pearl (June Allyson) whom he calls Butch. He becomes a gunner in a bomber. Next he becomes a jet test pilot. During the Korean war, he becomes a flying ace.\n\nIt's a silly start to a serious biopic of a war hero. It can't be the truth although maybe it is. The light tone is just accentuating the blandness of the story. It's old fashion and lacking in drama. I don't mind the romantic pairing but a little massaging could generate a better meet-cute. Why can't she be the one who picks him up after the parachute? Are they strictly keeping to the real history? I doubt it. The war fighting in the first hour is not the best but it's still better than the ground level story. At least, it has some real flying footage and that saves this relatively flat war biopic. After the first hour, the fighting becomes some nice jet dogfights. It's great to see these old jets up close and in combat. It's really the only truly compelling aspect of this film.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":514,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"Approved","genre":["Drama","War"],"datePublished":"1955-12-02","keywords":"character name as title,joseph c. mcconnell chatacter,surname in title,the white house,worry","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000042/","name":"Alan Ladd"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000742/","name":"June Allyson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0926235/","name":"James Whitmore"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0235066/","name":"Gordon Douglas"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0792090/","name":"Ted Sherdeman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0738222/","name":"Sam Rolfe"}],"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0048364, Title: The McConnell Story, --- Description: The McConnell Story: Directed by Gordon Douglas. With Alan Ladd, June Allyson, James Whitmore, Frank Faylen. A Korean War fighter pilot hero returns home to test fly the new Sabre jets despite his wife's uneasiness regarding his job." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0048364/","name":"The McConnell Story","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2MzMyOTI2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDA2NDMyMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A Korean War fighter pilot hero returns home to test fly the new Sabre jets despite his wife's uneasiness regarding his job.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0048364/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"SnoopyStyle","dateCreated":"2021-09-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"flat ground story with some flying footage","reviewBody":"It's WWII. Army private Joseph "Mac" McConnell, Jr. (Alan Ladd) goes AWOL to learn to fly and escapes from the MPs. He gets a ride from teenager Bob Brown and falls for Bob's sister Pearl (June Allyson) whom he calls Butch. He becomes a gunner in a bomber. Next he becomes a jet test pilot. During the Korean war, he becomes a flying ace.\n\nIt's a silly start to a serious biopic of a war hero. It can't be the truth although maybe it is. The light tone is just accentuating the blandness of the story. It's old fashion and lacking in drama. I don't mind the romantic pairing but a little massaging could generate a better meet-cute. Why can't she be the one who picks him up after the parachute? Are they strictly keeping to the real history? I doubt it. The war fighting in the first hour is not the best but it's still better than the ground level story. At least, it has some real flying footage and that saves this relatively flat war biopic. After the first hour, the fighting becomes some nice jet dogfights. It's great to see these old jets up close and in combat. It's really the only truly compelling aspect of this film.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":514,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4,"contentRating":"Approved","genre":["Drama","War"],"datePublished":"1955-12-02","keywords":"character name as title,joseph c. mcconnell chatacter,surname in title,the white house,worry","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000042/","name":"Alan Ladd","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000742/","name":"June Allyson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0926235/","name":"James Whitmore"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0235066/","name":"Gordon Douglas"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0792090/","name":"Ted Sherdeman","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0738222/","name":"Sam Rolfe"],"duration":"PT1H46M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Bébert et l'omnibus
Bébert et l'omnibus
programme.desc:
Bébert et l'omnibus: Directed by Yves Robert. With Martin Lartigue, Blanchette Brunoy, Pierre Mondy, Jean Richard. While their parents are busy shopping in a department store, Tiennot, who would rather chase girls, buys the complicity of Bébert, his little brother. In the train on the way back home, Tiennot, infuriated by his whims, leaves Bébert in the last car, which happens to be separated from the train and headed in another direction. Panic in the family: where on earth is Bébert? In fact, the little rascal has been taken in by the station master of Verneuil L'Etang, where he has a great time wreaking havoc in the SNCF network. A good-natured inspector is called on the spot and Bébert is finally reunited with his family." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0056892/","name":"Bébert et l'omnibus","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTRjZGQzM2EtZjYzOS00N2FjLWFiOGItMjZkZWZlZmVlZWVhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjI5NTk0MzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"While their parents are busy shopping in a department store, Tiennot, who would rather chase girls, buys the complicity of Bébert, his little brother. In the train on the way back home, Tiennot, infuriated by his whims, leaves Bébert","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0056892/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dbdumonteil"},"dateCreated":"2006-10-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Petit Gibus","reviewBody":"The (deserved)huge success of Yves Robert's "La guerre des boutons" was the main reason for which this film was made.It was obviously written by the same scenarist to capitalize on wiz kid Martin Lartigue aka "Petit Gibus"'s success ,cause he was the stand out of Robert's previous movie.But the boy's spontaneity has disappeared here.He's showing off all along the movie.

It is a the story of a brat who gets lost on the French trains (Bebert and the local train).It is sometimes funny but the young lead is infuriating.Cast includes Jacques Higelin (later a famous French singer),Jean Richard (who was featured in "la Guerre des Boutons" ,but as Lebrac's father) ,Michel Serrault and Yves Robert himself.

Get "La Guerre des Boutons" instead."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":151,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"genre":["Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"1963-12-03","keywords":"based on novel","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0489315/","name":"Martin Lartigue"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0116558/","name":"Blanchette Brunoy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0597816/","name":"Pierre Mondy"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002216/","name":"Yves Robert"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0013404/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0102030/","name":"François Boyer"}],"duration":"PT1H35M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Ship of Fools
La nef des fous
programme.desc:
Ship of Fools: Directed by Stanley Kramer. With Vivien Leigh, Simone Signoret, José Ferrer, Lee Marvin. A varied group of passengers boarding a ship bound for pre-WWII Germany represents a microcosm of early 1930s society." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0059712/","name":"Ship of Fools","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzM0Y2M3MzktYjQ4Yy00ZDYyLWIxMzktMzRjMzZiYTFhOGJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjUwNzk3NDc@._V1_.jpg","description":"A varied group of passengers boarding a ship bound for pre-WWII Germany represents a microcosm of early 1930s society.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0059712/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Red-125"},"dateCreated":"2007-03-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not as good as the novel, but still worth seeing","reviewBody":"Ship of Fools (1965) directed by Stanley Kramer, is based on the novel by Katherine Anne Porter. The film is a reasonably faithful cinematic adaptation, although it lacks the novel's subtlety and complexity. Director Kramer assembled an all-star cast--including Vivien Leigh (her last film), Simone Signoret, José Ferrer, Lee Marvin, Oskar Werner, José Greco, and George Segal.

The film takes place entirely on shipboard, except for the final scene. Naturally, the close confines of the ship and the lack of privacy bring about forced interactions, as would have been the case in reality. These interactions form the basic plot of both the book and the film. 

The time is 1933, so the passengers don't know what we know--things are changing rapidly in Germany and everything will be different in just a year or two. In fact, that's the basic weakness of the plot--it's easy in retrospect to know just how wrong the Jewish salesman is when he assures people that the current unpleasantness will blow over and all will be well.

Some features of the novel were unfortunately omitted from the film, especially the roles of the Spanish twins, Ric and Rac. In the novel, they are the embodiments of senseless evil, and every chapter in which they appear is laden with foreboding. In the film, the children commit one evil act, but it makes no sense because we haven't been prepared for it. 

Director Kramer made one choice I consider foolish. In the novel, a young woman named Elsa Lutz is realistically unhappy. She is unattractive, not very intelligent, not gifted or graceful, and her prospects for marriage are bleak. In the film, she is portrayed as a stunning ingénue, who will blossom into an even more stunning woman. No dramatic tension there. Porter had it right, Kramer had it wrong.

All in all, "Ship of Fools" is a classic movie by an excellent director and it's loaded with stars. It's not an essential film, but it's entertaining enough and worth renting.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5774,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Romance","War"],"datePublished":"1965-10-01","keywords":"ocean voyage,16 year old,16 year old teenage girl,46 year old woman,42 year old woman","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Ship of Fools","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3699507481","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjNiNzMzYjItNjEzNS00NjMzLWE0YTUtNzJmNzlhMDI3YzJmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjNiNzMzYjItNjEzNS00NjMzLWE0YTUtNzJmNzlhMDI3YzJmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000046/","name":"Vivien Leigh"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0797531/","name":"Simone Signoret"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001207/","name":"José Ferrer"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0006452/","name":"Stanley Kramer"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0136675/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0692188/","name":"Katherine Anne Porter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0542631/","name":"Abby Mann"}],"duration":"PT2H29M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: César et Cléopâtre
programme.desc: Jules César arrive avec ses troupes à Alexandrie en 45 avant J.-C. Il découvre alors une jeune fille, Cléopâtre, qu'il réhabilite auprès de sa nourrice Ftatateeta et de son jeune frère Ptolémée, qui veut lui ravir le trône avec la complicité de Pothinus. César parvient à mettre sa protégée sur le trône, mais ses ennemis veillent. Tandis que la bibliothèque d'Alexandrie brûle, César et son fidèle chef des légions Rufio partent au front. Vexée, Cléopâtre rejoint son mentor en se cachant dans un tapis grâce à Appolodorus, un marchand. Quelque temps plus tard, Cléopâtre, devenue femme, ruse par orgueil avec César en faisant éliminer Pothinus par Ftatateeta.

programme.title: Era notte a Roma
Les évadés de la nuit
programme.desc:
Era notte a Roma: Directed by Roberto Rossellini. With Leo Genn, Giovanna Ralli, Sergey Bondarchuk, Hannes Messemer. Three allied prisoners, a Russian, an American and an Englishman, attempt to escape with the help of a young couple from Rome." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0052781/","name":"Era notte a Roma","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk4MzU5OTIxNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTI4Nzk1MDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three allied prisoners, a Russian, an American and an Englishman, attempt to escape with the help of a young couple from Rome.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0052781/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"strong-122-478885"},"dateCreated":"2014-08-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Rossellini's WW2 Drama Misses The Mark","reviewBody":"For starters - At an unbearable 134 minutes, this 1960, WW2 Drama, directed by Italian film-maker, Roberto Rossellini, was truly something of an endurance test for this frustrated and bored viewer.

Escape By Night's action (or lack of it) was set at such a deliberately s-l-o-w snail's pace, and every situation was dragged out beyond reason, that, sure enough, I ended up nodding off to sleep more than once.

On top of that, this wartime picture did not contain one, single battle scene in it. You can be sure, had a few worthwhile explosions taken place, here & there, that definitely would have helped to alleviate some of this story's stifling monotony.

In this tale of cat-n-mouse, all that Rossellini seemed concerned about was dealing with the trifling personal dramas that dogged its characters.

But, unfortunately, this directorial short-sightedness on Rosellini's part didn't go over very well with this viewer, since none of the characters in the story were really all that interesting or worthy of much attention to begin with.

Believe it or not - The absolute highlight of this mundane picture was when a turkey (that's right - a turkey!!) escaped from Esperia's home and this excitement sent all of the delighted, neighbourhood children scampering down the dirty street after it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":3}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":662,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Drama","War"],"datePublished":"1961-07-05","keywords":"year 1944,year 1943,1940s,rome,kingdom of italy","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0312890/","name":"Leo Genn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0707728/","name":"Giovanna Ralli"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0094083/","name":"Sergey Bondarchuk"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0744023/","name":"Roberto Rossellini"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007652/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0112830/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0024847/","name":"Sergio Amidei"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0264420/","name":"Diego Fabbri"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0740021/","name":"Brunello Rondi"}],"duration":"PT2H18M"}</script><metacontent="
