programme.title: La Cordillera
El presidente
programme.desc: La Cordillera: Directed by Santiago Mitre. With Walter Andrade, Ricardo Darín, Dolores Fonzi, José María Marcos. At a summit for Latin American presidents in Chile where the region's geopolitical strategies and alliances are in discussion, Argentine president Hernán Blanco endures political and family drama that will force him to face his own demons." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6047298/","name":"La Cordillera","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWRkZWM3MDktMjNmNi00ZmNjLTgxMmUtM2YwYmRlNWU3YjEyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"At a summit for Latin American presidents in Chile where the region's geopolitical strategies and alliances are in discussion, Argentine president Hernán Blanco endures political and family drama that will force him to face his own d","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6047298/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kaimenkf-90445"},"dateCreated":"2017-08-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"A good film, great actors, interesting dialogues, very good director, excellent music","reviewBody":"I really liked La Cordillera (The summit). Political thriller is not the most usual subject in Argentina's filming. Just for this, this deserves a lot of recognition. The script is intense, very touching. Maybe some viewers will feel as if there were some minutes missing...but whenever you think about the film, this grows. I enjoyed the director so much...the "Cordillera de los Andes" that gives the film a name...is a silent Main protagonist. Beautiful, fascinating, incredible. In the middle of nowhere, some crucial meeting among south American presidents is being held. Darin is superb as usual, as the Argentina's President. for the reluctant, I suggest you to give The Summit a chance.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3650,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Mystery","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2017-08-17","keywords":"latin america,south america,south american president,airplane,reference to twitter","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Tráiler [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi446937625","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmY5M2U3ZGEtN2UzNy00ZmFjLWIyOTctMjEyOWYzYjVmZTNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmY5M2U3ZGEtN2UzNy00ZmFjLWIyOTctMjEyOWYzYjVmZTNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5408383/","name":"Walter Andrade"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0201857/","name":"Ricardo Darín"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0285135/","name":"Dolores Fonzi"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1377207/","name":"Santiago Mitre"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0393274/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0334662/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0465776/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1183471/","name":"Mariano Llinás"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1377207/","name":"Santiago Mitre"}],"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Grand Budapest Hotel
The Grand Budapest Hotel
programme.desc:
The Grand Budapest Hotel: Directed by Wes Anderson. With Ralph Fiennes, F. Murray Abraham, Mathieu Amalric, Adrien Brody. A writer encounters the owner of an aging high-class hotel, who tells him of his early years serving as a lobby boy in the hotel's glorious years under an exceptional concierge." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2278388/","name":"The Grand Budapest Hotel","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzM5NjUxOTEyMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjEyMDM0MDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A writer encounters the owner of an aging high-class hotel, who tells him of his early years serving as a lobby boy in the hotel's glorious years under an exceptional concierge.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2278388/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"edgereviews"},"dateCreated":"2014-03-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"Wes Anderson's Best?","reviewBody":"I would consider myself a Wes Anderson fan, however in saying that, I have only seen a handful of his movies. I was very excited for The Grand Budapest Hotel, because of its excellent cast, the fact it's directed by Wes Anderson and just by how unique it looked. After watching The Grand Budapest Hotel, I can confidently say that it's my new favourite Wes Anderson film, and probably his best.

As I was hoping, the story to The Grand Budapest Hotel is very original and unique, some may even say strange. And as the movie goes on, the story only gets wilder and wilder. The film is often very hilarious, with some seriously funny dark humour thrown in there as well. Characters are extremely well written, with the bond between Gustave and Zero being the backbone of the whole movie as it's so well written. The Grand Budapest Hotel features an odd narrative structure that works very well for the film, again adding to the uniqueness and freshness of it. I wasn't exactly sure how the story would play out, as I purposely avoided all promotional materiel so I would know as little as possible before watching. This was a great benefit to my viewing experience as I loved everything I saw, and felt as though nothing was spoiled from watching too many trailers.

I haven't been a huge fan of most of Ralph Fiennes' work since his phenomenal performance in 1993′s "Schindler's List", but this is easily his best performance since then. He proves he can do comedy just as well as he can do drama, providing a perfect balance of both. Newcomer Tony Revolori is excellent as well. I won't get into the whole supporting cast because there's so many who were all so great, but I was particularly impressed by Willem Dafoe, Adrien Brody, Harvey Keitel, Jude Law and Saoirse Ronan.

The Grand Budapest Hotel is definitely a Wes Anderson film, down to its very core. If you know his style, then you known what to expect, as this movie is full of it. Thankfully though, it's not a case of style over substance, with a great story to accompany the gorgeous visuals. The colour palette is beautiful; it's nice to see lot's of bright colours when so many other films are so dark and dreary. The set design and costumes are perfect, and there's so much attention to detail within the sets. The cinematography is phenomenal, and I really like how the film was presented in different aspect ratios.

You really can't go wrong with this film. It's probably Wes Anderson's best film, it has gorgeous visuals, excellent acting and a wonderful story. If you're a fan of Wes Anderson's previous work, you cannot miss this, and even if you're not a fan you should go and see it anyway.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":748222,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.1},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2014-03-06","keywords":"hotel,lobby boy,first person narration,painting,prison escape","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"International Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1157933593","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgxODI4OTU3N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODgzNDMzMTE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgxODI4OTU3N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODgzNDMzMTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The adventures of Gustave H, a legendary concierge at a famous European hotel between the wars, and Zero Moustafa, the lobby boy who becomes his most trusted friend.
"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000146/","name":"Ralph Fiennes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000719/","name":"F. Murray Abraham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0023832/","name":"Mathieu Amalric"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0027572/","name":"Wes Anderson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028932/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0215519/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0053177/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0959003/","name":"Stefan Zweig"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0027572/","name":"Wes Anderson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2450453/","name":"Hugo Guinness"}],"duration":"PT1H39M"}</script><metacontent="

I was very excited for The Grand Budapest Hotel, because of its excellent cast, the fact it's directed by Wes Anderson and just by how unique it looked. After watching The Grand Budapest Hotel, I can confidently say that it's my new favourite Wes Anderson film, and probably his best.

As I was hoping, the story to The Grand Budapest Hotel is very original and unique, some may even say strange. And as the movie goes on, the story only gets wilder and wilder. The film is often very hilarious, with some seriously funny dark humour thrown in there as well. Characters are extremely well written, with the bond between Gustave and Zero being the backbone of the whole movie as it's so well written. This was a great benefit to my viewing experience as I loved everything I saw, and felt as though nothing was spoiled from watching too many trailers.

I haven't been a huge fan of most of Ralph Fiennes' work since his phenomenal performance in 1993′s "Schindler's List", but this is easily his best performance since then. He proves he can do comedy just as well as he can do drama, providing a perfect balance of both. Newcomer Tony Revolori is excellent as well. I won't get into the whole supporting cast because there's so many who were all so great, but I was particularly impressed by Willem Dafoe, Adrien Brody, Harvey Keitel, Jude Law and Saoirse Ronan.

The Grand Budapest Hotel is definitely a Wes Anderson film, down to its very core. If you know his style, then you known what to expect, as this movie is full of it. Thankfully though, it's not a case of style over substance, with a great story to accompany the gorgeous visuals. The colour palette is beautiful; it's nice to see lot's of bright colours when so many other films are so dark and dreary. The set design and costumes are perfect, and there's so much attention to detail within the sets. The cinematography is phenomenal, and I really like how the film was presented in different aspect ratios.

You really can't go wrong with this film. It's probably Wes Anderson's best film, it has gorgeous visuals, excellent acting and a wonderful story. programme.title: Jacob's Ladder
L'échelle de Jacob
programme.desc: Jacob's Ladder: Directed by Adrian Lyne. With Tim Robbins, Elizabeth Peña, Danny Aiello, Matt Craven. Mourning his dead child, a haunted Vietnam War veteran attempts to uncover his past while suffering from a severe case of dissociation. To do so, he must decipher reality and life from his own dreams, delusions, and perceptions of death." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0099871/","name":"Jacob's Ladder","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTg5MTMyNjktNTZhOC00MGFlLWFlMTMtZGU2MjE3OWQ3NjJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzkwMjQ5NzM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Mourning his dead child, a haunted Vietnam War veteran attempts to uncover his past while suffering from a severe case of dissociation. To do so, he must decipher reality and life from his own dreams, delusions, and perceptions of de","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0099871/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"eraceheadd"},"dateCreated":"2000-03-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"A visual masterpiece of horror and conspiracy.","reviewBody":"This is easily one of Adrian Lyne's best films. Tim Robbins is excellent and the visual affects were just awesome. I saw this movie for the first time in the theatre and it blew me away. I've seen it many times after that, purely for the visuals that were done so well. The plot twists and turns as it spirals downward slowly revealing the truth and keeps you guessing all the way to the surprising ending. This is a dark, violent, beautiful movie that I recommend to all people who love horror, and just a smart story that will keep you in suspense until the very end.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":103504,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Horror","Mystery"],"datePublished":"1990-11-02","keywords":"soldier,vietnam,new york,delusion,vietnam war veteran","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Jacob's Ladder","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2761031961","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjgyOTI1NDItNTViNS00ZjkzLWE0YTQtNDVjZjE2ZTI4ZTRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjgyOTI1NDItNTViNS00ZjkzLWE0YTQtNDVjZjE2ZTI4ZTRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Columbia Tristar"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000209/","name":"Tim Robbins"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001615/","name":"Elizabeth Peña"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000732/","name":"Danny Aiello"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001490/","name":"Adrian Lyne"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0094459/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0748022/","name":"Bruce Joel Rubin"}],"duration":"PT1H53M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: City Hall
City Hall
programme.desc: City Hall: Directed by Frederick Wiseman. With Marty Walsh. A look at Boston's city government, covering racial justice, housing, climate action, and more." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt12094720/","name":"City Hall","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTIzNGE1NmItODNjMC00NjUwLTk3MjktMjc1YmY2NWYxOThlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A look at Boston's city government, covering racial justice, housing, climate action, and more.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt12094720/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"allie701"},"dateCreated":"2020-12-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"4 hours with no editing makes a very boring film","reviewBody":"What a self-indulgent offering. He just let the camera go with no apparent effort at reining in these blowhard politicians. If he could make a point in 2 minutes, he'd let the scenes go on for ten. You think sitting in a meeting where you have an interest in the outcome can be boring? Just wait til you are watching these party hacks sitting around a table and droning on about subjects that really don't interest you. I understand this building is being torn down which I guess was all the reason Wiseman needed to make this documentary. Fine, put it in the archives as a permanent record of its role in the city but don't expect anyone but the participants to want to watch this.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":548,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"genre":["Documentary"],"datePublished":"2020-10-28","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2644623641","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjRjZjFiYmMtNGQ0Ni00MzI5LWE3ZTItODUxYWE1YTQ2MWZjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjRjZjFiYmMtNGQ0Ni00MzI5LWE3ZTItODUxYWE1YTQ2MWZjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A documentary that shows the efforts by the Boston city government, led by Mayor Martin Walsh, to address racial justice, affordable housing, climate action, homelessness, and support for seniors, immigrants, and veterans."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7083477/","name":"Marty Walsh"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0936464/","name":"Frederick Wiseman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0615993/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002222/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0668124/"}],"duration":"PT4H32M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Ex Libris: The New York Public Library
Ex Libris : New York Public Library
programme.desc: Ex Libris: The New York Public Library: Directed by Frederick Wiseman. With Ta-Nehisi Coates, Elvis Costello, Richard Dawkins, Edmund de Waal. A look within the walls of the New York Public Library." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6209282/","name":"Ex Libris: The New York Public Library","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWI3ZTFhMTAtNmRkOS00NzgxLWE1MWYtMmQ0ZjRhZTliODJmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"A look within the walls of the New York Public Library.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6209282/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"felice-witch-1"},"dateCreated":"2018-07-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"So moving and inspiring, I want to work for the NYPL!","reviewBody":"This documentary is extraordinary! Inspiring! Educational in a profound way. Not just about culture and history, but about humanity and our contemporary world with its complexe histories and fast coming future. Somehow, it achieves what I think the New York Public Library sets out to do for all its patrons: Open our minds, our hearts, give us hope and enthusiasm and bring us closer as a human community. I live in Edinburgh but felt so connected to everyone in this film. And without the use of a single interview! I love New York and now I realise that part of the soul of the city lies in this incredible institution. Man it is good to see powerful people who care! And people from all walks of life who care! I commend the filmmaker and the New York Public library for their incredible work. I would work for either in a heartbeat! A look within the walls of the New York Public Library." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6209282/","name":"Ex Libris: The New York Public Library","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWI3ZTFhMTAtNmRkOS00NzgxLWE1MWYtMmQ0ZjRhZTliODJmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"A look within the walls of the New York Public Library.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6209282/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"felice-witch-1","dateCreated":"2018-07-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"So moving and inspiring, I want to work for the NYPL!","reviewBody":"This documentary is extraordinary! Inspiring! Educational in a profound way. Not just about culture and history, but about humanity and our contemporary world with its complexe histories and fast coming future. Somehow, it achieves what I think the New York Public Library sets out to do for all its patrons: Open our minds, our hearts, give us hope and enthusiasm and bring us closer as a human community. I live in Edinburgh but felt so connected to everyone in this film. And without the use of a single interview! I love New York and now I realise that part of the soul of the city lies in this incredible institution. Man it is good to see powerful people who care! And people from all walks of life who care! I commend the filmmaker and the New York Public library for their incredible work. I would work for either in a heartbeat! programme.title: Jane Birkin, simple icône
programme.desc: Sa longue frange, son accent British et son couple avec Serge Gainsbourg dans les années 1970 ont marqué les imaginaires. À la fois actrice et mère, muse et militante, chanteuse et sex-symbol, Jane Birkin a traversé les époques depuis cinquante ans avec un panache qui l’a érigée au rang d’icône. De scènes de vie en sessions d’enregistrements, d’extraits de films en interviews, où l’actrice et chanteuse révèle son espièglerie, la réalisatrice Clélia Cohen éclaire les multiples visages d'une femme intemporelle.
programme.category: Rock-pop

programme.title: 2020, la vie sur Terre
programme.desc: Le 16 mars 2020, la pandémie de Covid-19 se propage et la France se prépare au confinement. Le monde s'arrête. Six réalisateurs filment jusqu'à son terme ce temps de confinement. De ces six récits, Stéphane Jourdain et Dominique Auvray ont fait un seul film.
programme.category: Société

programme.title: Soul Kitchen
Soul Kitchen
programme.desc: Soul Kitchen: Directed by Fatih Akin. With Adam Bousdoukos, Moritz Bleibtreu, Pheline Roggan, Anna Bederke. In Hamburg, German-Greek chef Zinos unknowingly disturbs the peace in his locals-only restaurant by hiring a more talented chef." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1244668/","name":"Soul Kitchen","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDg3MGIyYWEtOGRkYS00NWY5LWI3MDctMDY1NWJjZDlkOGE1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDk3NzU2MTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"In Hamburg, German-Greek chef Zinos unknowingly disturbs the peace in his locals-only restaurant by hiring a more talented chef.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1244668/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kosmasp"},"dateCreated":"2010-03-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"If you smell, what Faith is cookin ...","reviewBody":"You could be excused, if by hearing the title, you'd thought this is yet another "urban" comedy, starring Martin Lawrence or Ice Cube or Queen Latifah. It ain't so. While the title might be misleading (in quite a few ways), the characters in this aren't. You have finely structured people (with a cliché here and there), who seem to have their everyday problems and find a way to live with them.\n\nOur main character has quite a few struggles to go through this movie, some of them come "back" at him (no pun intended). And while quite a few things are more than cliché (the brother and what he does towards the end, is borderline believable, even with the setup through the movie), it has quite a few nice touches to it. All in all, a warm comedy, that goes more for the heart than the brain. A nice change of pace by Faith Akin and a movie, whose flaws shouldn't hinder you enjoying it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":37570,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2009-12-25","keywords":"restaurant,chef,cook,2000s,burglar","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Soul Kitchen","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3270837785","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ0MTM1MjYzNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjc0OTUyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ0MTM1MjYzNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjc0OTUyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"In Hamburg, German-Greek chef Zinos unknowingly disturbs the peace in his locals-only restaurant by hiring a more talented chef."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0100196/","name":"Adam Bousdoukos"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001953/","name":"Moritz Bleibtreu"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2114493/","name":"Pheline Roggan"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0015359/","name":"Fatih Akin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0090290/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0123730/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0190323/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0015359/","name":"Fatih Akin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0100196/","name":"Adam Bousdoukos"}],"duration":"PT1H39M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Garçon
Garçon !
programme.desc: Garçon!: Directed by Claude Sautet. With Yves Montand, Nicole Garcia, Jacques Villeret, Rosy Varte. A middle-aged waiter has long harbored dreams of becoming a singer, and is also anxious to prove he's as virile as he was when he started pushing plates. He gets a chance to rev up his sexual energy and his musical skills when an old flame reenters his life after 17 years." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0085576/","name":"Garçon!","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzU3MTNlNjItYWI0MC00OGZkLWI0M2MtMGRjY2YwNDdlZWY4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEyODk3NTgz._V1_.jpg","description":"A middle-aged waiter has long harbored dreams of becoming a singer, and is also anxious to prove he's as virile as he was when he started pushing plates. programme.title: Frost/Nixon
Frost/Nixon, l'heure de verité
programme.desc:
Frost/Nixon: Directed by Ron Howard. With Frank Langella, Michael Sheen, Sam Rockwell, Kevin Bacon. A dramatic retelling of the post-Watergate television interviews between British talk-show host David Frost and former president Richard Nixon." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0870111/","name":"Frost/Nixon","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTY4NTU2NTU4NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjE0OTc5MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A dramatic retelling of the post-Watergate television interviews between British talk-show host David Frost and former president Richard Nixon.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0870111/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"IMDb-627"},"dateCreated":"2008-10-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not to be missed! Vey rewarding","reviewBody":"I had the pleasure of watching this gripping movie at the opening night of the British Film festival. Ron Howard's direction and story telling ability are in top form with this effort. From the very first scene a carefully crafted and very credible 70s's atmosphere sets a solid stage for the superbly cast film and quickly transports the viewer into the political jungle that was "Tricky Dickey's" playground.

The acting duo of Frank Langella & Micheal Sheen (Nixon & Frost) are set on a collision course that finds two deeply passionate personalities at the mercy of their insatiable desires. Both actor's portrayals are a study of affectation and body language, pleasurably accurate and yet not simply an impersonation. Indeed, the film never strays from the distinct Howard format that breathes so much life (read intimacy) into this familiar and yet mysterious relationship that exists for so many people who lived through the exceptional event.

Make no mistake, this is by no means a two man show, quite the contrary. In fact, the wealth of supporting roles is perhaps the finest feature of this production. Bacon's devoted and stalwart marine practically glints of gun metal and polished shoe leather. The trio of Gould, Platt and Rockwell portray effortlessly the roles of the men who, brick by brick, constructed the platform from which Frost so successfully and serendipitously elicited one of the greatest unspoken confessions of all time. Rebecca Hall is delicious and demure, constantly filling scenes with her elegant presence.

Perhaps the richest praise should be reserved for Peter Morgan, who has, without question, penned a truly captivating and insightful story that delivers not only a satisfying comprehension of a complex time in US history, but captures a generation's struggle to come to terms with the frailty of leadership that still echoes today.

Not to be missed, this film can be enjoyed on multiple levels and will undoubtedly be regarded as seminal for it's engrossing insight and expert depiction.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":105950,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Drama","History"],"datePublished":"2009-01-23","keywords":"watergate,based on real person,interview,telephone call,reference to john f. kennedy","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Frost/Nixon: Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3600351257","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI4MzUwMjQ4NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjMzNzg4MQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI4MzUwMjQ4NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjMzNzg4MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"This is the first theatrical trailer for Ron Howard's Frost/Nixon."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001449/","name":"Frank Langella"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0790688/","name":"Michael Sheen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000102/","name":"Kevin Bacon"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000165/","name":"Ron Howard"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003687/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057311/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0604948/","name":"Peter Morgan"}],"duration":"PT2H2M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Magic Mike
Magic Mike
programme.desc: Magic Mike: Directed by Steven Soderbergh. With Matthew McConaughey, Channing Tatum, Olivia Munn, Alex Pettyfer. A male stripper teaches a younger performer how to party, pick up women, and make easy money." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1915581/","name":"Magic Mike","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQzMDMzOTA5M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjc4MTg4Nw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A male stripper teaches a younger performer how to party, pick up women, and make easy money.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1915581/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"preppy-3"},"dateCreated":"2012-06-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Aside from the stripping there's nothing new here but I was never bored","reviewBody":"This takes place in Florida. A 30 year old male stripper Magic Mike (Channing Tatum) meets young Adam (Alex Pettyfer) who has no direction in life. Mike takes him under his wing and gets him to be a stripper. He also romances Adams' sister Brooke (Cody Horn). But Adam gets hooked on drugs and things get dangerous.\n\nFirst let's get the nude issue out of the way. There is only one full frontal in the movie--it's off to the side, is partially blocked and is probably faked. It's also very funny. There's mostly butt shots only but all are from Tatum, Pettyfer and Adam Rodriguez. This movie is NOT about the nudity. The movie moves slow (although I was never bored) and main events happen off screen OR are never explained! Still the movie works. For one thing all the acting is good. I was surprised at how good Tatum was. I never thought he could act till this. He captures his character perfectly. Pettyfer was equally good as Adam. Even Matthew McConaughey was good as the group's owner named Dallas. The strip acts themselves are incredible. All the guys are in good shape and Tatum shows some moves that are jaw-dropping! However they're not shot in an exploitive fashion. They're done in a matter of fact way that actually makes them seem quite funny. This movie (script wise) shows us nothing new but it was well-made and entertaining. This is not just for women and gay men--I think everyone would enjoy it. I give it a 7.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":134945,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2012-06-29","keywords":"male stripper,male nudity,abs,stripper,party","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"No. 1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi889627417","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDdiNzgzZTMtOTI2YS00NTA5LWJkMTYtZDQ3ZDFmM2EzZGQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQUlNRGJWaWRlb1RodW1ibmFpbFNlcnZpY2U@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDdiNzgzZTMtOTI2YS00NTA5LWJkMTYtZDQ3ZDFmM2EzZGQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQUlNRGJWaWRlb1RodW1ibmFpbFNlcnZpY2U@._V1_.jpg","description":"Mike, an experienced stripper, takes a younger performer called The Kid under his wing and schools him in the arts of partying, picking up women, and making easy money."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1475594/","name":"Channing Tatum"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1641117/","name":"Alex Pettyfer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1601397/","name":"Olivia Munn"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001752/","name":"Steven Soderbergh"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0380595/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0265102/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0332172/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1730221/","name":"Reid Carolin"}],"duration":"PT1H50M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 1915581, Title: Magic Mike, --- Description: Magic Mike: Directed by Steven Soderbergh. With Matthew McConaughey, Channing Tatum, Olivia Munn, Alex Pettyfer. A male stripper teaches a younger performer how to party, pick up women, and make easy money." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1915581/","name":"Magic Mike","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQzMDMzOTA5M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjc4MTg4Nw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A male stripper teaches a younger performer how to party, pick up women, and make easy money.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1915581/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"preppy-3","dateCreated":"2012-06-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Aside from the stripping there's nothing new here but I was never bored","reviewBody":"This takes place in Florida. A 30 year old male stripper Magic Mike (Channing Tatum) meets young Adam (Alex Pettyfer) who has no direction in life. Mike takes him under his wing and gets him to be a stripper. He also romances Adams' sister Brooke (Cody Horn). But Adam gets hooked on drugs and things get dangerous.\n\nFirst let's get the nude issue out of the way. There is only one full frontal in the movie--it's off to the side, is partially blocked and is probably faked. It's also very funny. There's mostly butt shots only but all are from Tatum, Pettyfer and Adam Rodriguez. This movie is NOT about the nudity. The movie moves slow (although I was never bored) and main events happen off screen OR are never explained! Still the movie works. For one thing all the acting is good. I was surprised at how good Tatum was. I never thought he could act till this. He captures his character perfectly. Pettyfer was equally good as Adam. Even Matthew McConaughey was good as the group's owner named Dallas. The strip acts themselves are incredible. All the guys are in good shape and Tatum shows some moves that are jaw-dropping! However they're not shot in an exploitive fashion. They're done in a matter of fact way that actually makes them seem quite funny. This movie (script wise) shows us nothing new but it was well-made and entertaining. This is not just for women and gay men--I think everyone would enjoy it. I give it a 7.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":134945,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2012-06-29","keywords":"male stripper,male nudity,abs,stripper,party","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"No. 1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi889627417","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDdiNzgzZTMtOTI2YS00NTA5LWJkMTYtZDQ3ZDFmM2EzZGQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQUlNRGJWaWRlb1RodW1ibmFpbFNlcnZpY2U@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDdiNzgzZTMtOTI2YS00NTA5LWJkMTYtZDQ3ZDFmM2EzZGQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQUlNRGJWaWRlb1RodW1ibmFpbFNlcnZpY2U@._V1_.jpg","description":"Mike, an experienced stripper, takes a younger performer called The Kid under his wing and schools him in the arts of partying, picking up women, and making easy money.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1475594/","name":"Channing Tatum","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1641117/","name":"Alex Pettyfer","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1601397/","name":"Olivia Munn"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001752/","name":"Steven Soderbergh"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0380595/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0265102/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0332172/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1730221/","name":"Reid Carolin"],"duration":"PT1H50M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Ne croyez surtout pas que je hurle
Ne croyez surtout pas que je hurle
programme.desc: Ne croyez surtout pas que je hurle: Directed by Frank Beauvais. January 2016. The love story that brought me to this village in Alsace where I live ended six months ago. At 45, I am now alone, without a car, a job or any real prospects, surrounded by luxuriant nature, the proximity of which is not enough to calm the deep distress into which I am plunged. France, still in shock from the November terror attacks, is in a state of emergency. I feel helpless, I suffocate with contained rage. I am lost and I watch four to five films a day. I decide to record this stagnation, not by picking up a camera but by editing shots from the stream of films I watch." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9680914/","name":"Ne croyez surtout pas que je hurle","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2NmZWNhNzktOGI0OC00MDZiLWJhNTMtZjg1OTgxYTIxN2M3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzkyNjcxNA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"January 2016. The love story that brought me to this village in Alsace where I live ended six months ago. programme.title: The Boat That Rocked
Good Morning England
programme.desc:
The Boat That Rocked: Directed by Richard Curtis. With Michael Hadley, Charlie Rowe, Lucy Fleming, Philip Seymour Hoffman. A band of rogue DJs that captivated Britain, playing the music that defined a generation and standing up to a government that wanted classical music, and nothing else, on the airwaves." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1131729/","name":"The Boat That Rocked","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMzMjYzMTMyM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTk5NDA5Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A band of rogue DJs that captivated Britain, playing the music that defined a generation and standing up to a government that wanted classical music, and nothing else, on the airwaves.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1131729/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"birkir16"},"dateCreated":"2009-08-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"A simple "feel good" movie","reviewBody":"I'm going to keep this short. Watched it, loved it. 

It's a simple, "feel good" movie with the greatest music of the 60's and 70's that will make you smile. Sure it's not realistic when it comes to peoples communications and reactions to certain incidents but thats the charm of it. It even has a little twist of drama but not enough to ruin the comedy. 

It was amazing to me how the soundtrack just managed to get better and better, endless amount of rock/pop singles, thoughts like "aaaa i love that song" and " ohh man i had forgotten that one" often occurred to me. 

I thought the characters and the actors were great although some of the characters we're a bit useless i liked them after i was about 20 min into the film. 

I think we could use some pirate rock stations where i live, stations that will play and say what ever they please.

Final words. A movie witch is fun to watch.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":109344,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Music"],"datePublished":"2009-04-01","keywords":"pirate radio station,pop music,pirate radio,1960s,pirate broadcasting","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Pirate Radio","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1266090521","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2ODk3MTE4MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjM5NDYzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2ODk3MTE4MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjM5NDYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A comedy about an illegal radio station in the North Sea in the 1960s"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000450/","name":"Philip Seymour Hoffman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0631490/","name":"Bill Nighy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0296545/","name":"Nick Frost"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0193485/","name":"Richard Curtis"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047476/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057311/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0193485/","name":"Richard Curtis"}],"duration":"PT2H15M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Généalogies d'un crime
Généalogies d'un crime
programme.desc: Généalogies d'un crime: Directed by Raúl Ruiz. With Catherine Deneuve, Michel Piccoli, Melvil Poupaud, Andrzej Seweryn. At her son's funeral, Solange, a lawyer famous for losing hopeless cases, agrees to defend René, her son's age, accused of murdering his wealthy aunt, Jeanne, who's part of the Franco-Belgian Psychoanalytic Society, known for odd views and methods. She reads Jeanne's journal, documenting René's criminal tendencies. Solange believes him innocent, manipulated into the murder or framed. Odd psychiatrists turn up, including Georges Didier, who runs FBPS, and his rival, Christian, who believes crime originates in a story's taking hold of a person. After the verdict, René and Solange's relationship changes, Georges and his society commit a bizarre act, and the police record Solange's story." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0119242/","name":"Généalogies d'un crime","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA3NzkyNTM4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTQwNTA0MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"At her son's funeral, Solange, a lawyer famous for losing hopeless cases, agrees to defend René, her son's age, accused of murdering his wealthy aunt, Jeanne, who's part of the Franco-Belgian Psychoanalytic Society, known for odd vie","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0119242/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Xparanoid"},"dateCreated":"2004-12-12","inLanguage":"English","name":""You'll be me and I'll be you...... Beep!"","reviewBody":"If some directors make the cut into stardom and acknowledge maybe this isn't the gold for Raoul Ruiz. This great chilean director is one of the best on making a film completely out of new processed lines of ideas, brave imaginary and a perfectly narrated line of events that are shocking sometimes and very recreational through the whole story. In this film Catherine Deneuve shows her grace with a comfortably effortless acting being a legal attorney who solves a mystery on an assassination of a remarkable psychologist. Sometimes you see her good side, the intrigued professional that tries to form a bind with her young client Rene, the first suspect on the murder of his aunt the psychologist, but sometimes you get to see nothing but the real game. That is the true central object of the plot, about how the truth come to reveal to ourselves by being other people, or better said, by placing ourselves in other's perspective. Big twist at the end, and it was before our eyes every time.\n\n*notice the great adjustements on the camera lens through the film. Some filters and a half of screen out of focus with traveling at the same time!!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":873,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1997-03-26","keywords":"reference to the brothers karamazov the novel,nonlinear timeline,told in flashback,defense lawyer,murder of aunt","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000366/","name":"Catherine Deneuve"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0681566/","name":"Michel Piccoli"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0693799/","name":"Melvil Poupaud"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0749914/","name":"Raúl Ruiz"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0012500/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0067852/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028557/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0749914/","name":"Raúl Ruiz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0094726/","name":"Pascal Bonitzer"}],"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Trautmann
The Keeper
programme.desc:
Trautmann: Directed by Marcus H. Rosenmüller. With David Kross, Freya Mavor, John Henshaw, Harry Melling. The love story of a young English woman and a German PoW, who together overcome prejudice, public hostility and personal tragedy." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4642192/","name":"Trautmann","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGY2ODI0NDMtMmViMS00NGI2LWJlYWQtODk4NzlkNGVmMjU0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzE1ODI0OTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"The love story of a young English woman and a German PoW, who together overcome prejudice, public hostility and personal tragedy.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4642192/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mike_lowe_1"},"dateCreated":"2019-03-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Brilliant!","reviewBody":"A truly heartwarming story of reconciliation and the human condition. I watched this film in the Cinema in St. Helens. A town that is close to my heart and that features in Bert Trautmann's story before his time playing for Manchester City.

This movie is about so much more than football. I'm largely disinterested in the beautiful game but even I was bowled over by the brilliant humour and heartwarming story of redemption and reconciliation.

Watch this movie, tell your friends about it and talk about it. programme.category: Court métrage

programme.title: Les adoptés
Les adoptés
programme.desc:
Les adoptés: Directed by Mélanie Laurent. With Marie Denarnaud, Denis Ménochet, Clémentine Célarié, Mélanie Laurent. Lisa and her adopted sister Marine are inseparable. With Lisa's mother, Millie, they've forged a deep bond and offer security to Lisa's son. When Marine falls in love the family is thrown off balance and before they can catch their breath, tragedy strikes and the family must realign so they can turn loss into hope and love." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2004279/","name":"Les adoptés","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTQ3ODY5NzQyOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTI2NzAxMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Lisa and her adopted sister Marine are inseparable. With Lisa's mother, Millie, they've forged a deep bond and offer security to Lisa's son. When Marine falls in love the family is thrown off balance and before they can catch their b","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2004279/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"rightwingisevil"},"dateCreated":"2012-03-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"this is a fine and delicate french film","reviewBody":"you have to admit that when the french got a very good screenplay, then found a very good director, then the casting c.s.a. did a great job to find the appropriate actors to play it, then that film would be nothing but great, and this film just proved it. this is a very simply straight forward movie that we might or might not have watched before. the storyline is actually with one pretty directional development. the deep love of two young women, one of them was adopted as an orphan by a loving single-parental, free-willed independent mother, the elder sister treated the adopted one like a real sister. and the elder dramatically was a second generation single parent with a love young boy(who acted so naturally well and lovable in this film). the adopted daughter working in a bookstore with a lonely, always complaining, insecure female owner (also played so naturally well). she fell in love with a man who came in to seek sanctuary from the rain. they fell in love(gradually and also, so naturally in this film without any forced falsehood). she was loved so deeply by that man and sometimes so fearful of the commitment and wanted to escape the relationship and still tried to stay with her adopted family, her sister, her nephew, and her adopted mother. 

there were so many profound dialog about love, anti-commitment, family value, how to deal with personal demons, how to be loved and why you must love, why you have to seek someone out from the crowd and choose him or her for your life and the only person who would occupy in your whole life after you've found him or her.

and of course, the moon could never be always full, and flowers could never be stayed blossomed and always radiate wonderful smells. tragedy got to happen to make a drama evolve into the second but deeper level. and the scenario and the plot were both predictable and one directional, but in a very good development by the very crafty screenplay.

there is a very subtle agenda and ingredient in this movie that strongly claimed: the unavoidable loss and repetition of the fate; the fatal and doomed outcomes of the unforeseeable future (but is it really so foreseeable and/or so unpredictable? i don't think so). there seems an unsee-able being that we call 'fate' hiding behind everybody's life, manipulating you to go or reroute the paths of your life.

the other thought floated up when the movie came to end was: why french movie always used American pop songs at the beginning, in between and in the finale? are American songs the only choice that could be more compatible with a french movie? or the french sound trackers for their movies always considered American songs could match their movies more appropriately? or they thought the french songs in their french movies are not quite matching? what is it? this is a question that always came up onto my mind when watching the European movies, it's not just french movie only, German, Holland, the scandinavians, east europeans...they always chose American songs for their own unique movies. this is a myth that i'd like all the movie industries of all the countries other than the American to think about seriously. what's wrong with your own songs that you prefer not using them instead of the Americans?"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1518,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2011-11-23","keywords":"f rated,male nudity,female nudity,nudity,love","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0218884/","name":"Marie Denarnaud"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1616970/","name":"Denis Ménochet"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0194662/","name":"Clémentine Célarié"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0491259/","name":"Mélanie Laurent"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0065288/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047476/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0079764/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0491259/","name":"Mélanie Laurent"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0673580/","name":"Morgan Perez"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0973048/","name":"Christophe Deslandes"}],"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Black Swan
Black Swan
programme.desc:
Black Swan: Directed by Darren Aronofsky. With Natalie Portman, Mila Kunis, Vincent Cassel, Barbara Hershey. A committed dancer struggles to maintain her sanity after winning the lead role in a production of Tchaikovsky's "Swan Lake"." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0947798/","name":"Black Swan","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzY2NzI4OTE5MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjMyNDY4Mw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A committed dancer struggles to maintain her sanity after winning the lead role in a production of Tchaikovsky's "Swan Lake".","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0947798/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"hypercube"},"dateCreated":"2010-12-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Remarkable.. Aronofsky holds nothing back","reviewBody":"Yeah, it must be Darren Aronofsky, at it again. I'm certain I've just seen a brilliant piece of filmmaking, but at the same time I feel like I've just been run over by a convoy of trucks. It will be a while before I calm down enough to sleep, so here I am.

Not everyone is as big as of an Aronofsky's style as I am, but one thing that can't be denied is that he is great at working with actors. Ellen Burstyn, Mickey Rourke, and now Natalie Portman are all very accomplished actors who have found a new level and delivered transcendent performances under Aronofsky. In Black Swan, Natalie Portman's turn as Nina Sayers is, hands down, the best acting performance of 2010-- male or female. If you'll forgive the cliché, I completely forgot Nina was Natalie Portman about five minutes into the movie. As Nina goes deeper and deeper into her role as the Swan Queen, Portman only becomes more and more captivating. The entire cast is excellent, but Portman alone makes this movie a must-see.

Darren Aronofsky is at his boldest heading up Black Swan. His depiction of Nina's struggles as she succumbs to growing pressures from her director, her mother, her rivals, her physical ailments, her personal need for a perfect performance.. it is intense, thrilling, exhausting, and truly gripping throughout. Part of what makes it work is that we are completely along for the ride with Nina. We see what she sees, we experience what she experiences, and sometimes it is truly distressing stuff.

As great as the first 60-70 minutes are, man oh man, nothing can prepare you for the final 30. This finale takes you to places I can't even describe. I dare say it's on par with Requiem for a Dream's devastating third act. It's a masterfully crafted climax that only Aronofsky could deliver.

I am glad Aronofsky is able to do what he does. His brutal and uncompromising style is definitely not for everyone, and it's not box office gold, but for those viewers who connect with what he's doing, the experience is truly something special.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":725920,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2010-12-17","keywords":"ballerina,ballet,madness,female protagonist,lesbian kiss","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Black Swan: International Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3985807385","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA2MTU5Nzk4OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjc2NTcxNA@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA2MTU5Nzk4OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjc2NTcxNA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"While vying for the coveted lead roles in a production of Swan Lake, a veteran ballerina (Portman) enters into a twisted friendship with a promising new dancer (Kunis) that threatens to consume her."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000204/","name":"Natalie Portman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005109/","name":"Mila Kunis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001993/","name":"Vincent Cassel"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004716/","name":"Darren Aronofsky"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028932/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0285648/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0062935/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2114730/","name":"Mark Heyman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0374560/","name":"Andres Heinz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0572352/","name":"John J. McLaughlin"}],"duration":"PT1H48M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0947798, Title: Black Swan, --- Description: Black Swan: Directed by Darren Aronofsky. With Natalie Portman, Mila Kunis, Vincent Cassel, Barbara Hershey. A committed dancer struggles to maintain her sanity after winning the lead role in a production of Tchaikovsky's "Swan Lake"." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0947798/","name":"Black Swan","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzY2NzI4OTE5MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjMyNDY4Mw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A committed dancer struggles to maintain her sanity after winning the lead role in a production of Tchaikovsky's "Swan Lake".","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0947798/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"hypercube","dateCreated":"2010-12-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Remarkable.. Aronofsky holds nothing back","reviewBody":"Yeah, it must be Darren Aronofsky, at it again. I'm certain I've just seen a brilliant piece of filmmaking, but at the same time I feel like I've just been run over by a convoy of trucks. It will be a while before I calm down enough to sleep, so here I am.

Not everyone is as big as of an Aronofsky's style as I am, but one thing that can't be denied is that he is great at working with actors. Ellen Burstyn, Mickey Rourke, and now Natalie Portman are all very accomplished actors who have found a new level and delivered transcendent performances under Aronofsky. In Black Swan, Natalie Portman's turn as Nina Sayers is, hands down, the best acting performance of 2010-- male or female. If you'll forgive the cliché, I completely forgot Nina was Natalie Portman about five minutes into the movie. As Nina goes deeper and deeper into her role as the Swan Queen, Portman only becomes more and more captivating. The entire cast is excellent, but Portman alone makes this movie a must-see.

Darren Aronofsky is at his boldest heading up Black Swan. His depiction of Nina's struggles as she succumbs to growing pressures from her director, her mother, her rivals, her physical ailments, her personal need for a perfect performance.. it is intense, thrilling, exhausting, and truly gripping throughout. Part of what makes it work is that we are completely along for the ride with Nina. We see what she sees, we experience what she experiences, and sometimes it is truly distressing stuff.

As great as the first 60-70 minutes are, man oh man, nothing can prepare you for the final 30. This finale takes you to places I can't even describe. I dare say it's on par with Requiem for a Dream's devastating third act. It's a masterfully crafted climax that only Aronofsky could deliver.

I am glad Aronofsky is able to do what he does. His brutal and uncompromising style is definitely not for everyone, and it's not box office gold, but for those viewers who connect with what he's doing, the experience is truly something special.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":725920,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2010-12-17","keywords":"ballerina,ballet,madness,female protagonist,lesbian kiss","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Black Swan: International Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3985807385","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA2MTU5Nzk4OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjc2NTcxNA@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA2MTU5Nzk4OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjc2NTcxNA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"While vying for the coveted lead roles in a production of Swan Lake, a veteran ballerina (Portman) enters into a twisted friendship with a promising new dancer (Kunis) that threatens to consume her.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000204/","name":"Natalie Portman","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005109/","name":"Mila Kunis","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001993/","name":"Vincent Cassel"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004716/","name":"Darren Aronofsky"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028932/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0285648/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0062935/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2114730/","name":"Mark Heyman","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0374560/","name":"Andres Heinz","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0572352/","name":"John J. programme.title: Rumor Has It..
La rumeur court
programme.desc: Rumor Has It...: Directed by Rob Reiner. With Jennifer Aniston, Kevin Costner, Shirley MacLaine, Mark Ruffalo. Sarah Huttinger is a woman who learns that her family was the inspiration for the book and film "The Graduate" -- and that she just might be the offspring of the well-documented event." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0398375/","name":"Rumor Has It...","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTg3Njk2NTIxNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTc4MTEzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Sarah Huttinger is a woman who learns that her family was the inspiration for the book and film "The Graduate" -- and that she just might be the offspring of the well-documented event.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0398375/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Chrysanthepop"},"dateCreated":"2008-07-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Rumor Lacks It","reviewBody":"'Rumor Has It' pretty much has all the technical ingredients: Good actors, interesting premise (a girl trying to find herself), excellent cinematography, breathtaking shots of America and a nice score. However, it's let down by the writing and direction. For a comedy, it's not so funny. Many of the jokes fall flat. For a drama, it just doesn't engage and a lot of it looks forced. The movie derails every now and then and the whole 'romantic' angle between Costner's Beau and Aniston's Sarah feels icky and looks unconvincing. Jennifer Aniston is in a confused Rachel Green mode (except here her character is not likable and she's a little too whiny). Mark Ruffalo does a decent job as the supportive boyfriend and shares a good chemistry with Aniston. Their scenes in the beginning are quite fun to watch. It's just the last scene that was a little less believable as Jeff seems to have forgiven Sarah too easily. Kevin Costner seems sleazy (when the character wasn't really meant to appear that way) and he and Aniston seem to lack chemistry. Mena Suvari has a pointless and thankless role. The last scene between her and Aniston just seemed ...well, forced. However, it is Shirley MacLaine who delivers the best performance. She provides all the laugh out loud moments but her role is too small to be the saving grace. Simply put, 'Rumor Has It' is a weak and confused film."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":56337,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2006-03-08","keywords":"biological father,author,search for father,female nudity,motor vehicle","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Rumor Has It...","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi26280217","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGU2ZDhiNTktMDkxYS00OWM5LTgyMTgtZDUyZDU5OGI0NGJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGU2ZDhiNTktMDkxYS00OWM5LTgyMTgtZDUyZDU5OGI0NGJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer #1 for Rumor Has It..."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000098/","name":"Jennifer Aniston"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0749263/","name":"Mark Ruffalo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000511/","name":"Shirley MacLaine"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001661/","name":"Rob Reiner"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108864/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0013349/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0341372/","name":"Ted Griffin"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Bombshell
Scandale
programme.desc: Bombshell: Directed by Jay Roach. With Charlize Theron, Nicole Kidman, Margot Robbie, John Lithgow. A group of women take on Fox News head Roger Ailes and the toxic atmosphere he presided over at the network." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6394270/","name":"Bombshell","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjlhOWE3YjktY2MzOC00ZmQ1LWIwNjgtZmVhZmFjZGExMzgyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDA4NzMyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A group of women take on Fox News head Roger Ailes and the toxic atmosphere he presided over at the network.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6394270/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"earthgirl-54214"},"dateCreated":"2019-12-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"WATCH IF YOU LIKE POLITICS","reviewBody":"This film is quite good, but I think you HAVE to like politics and know Fox News to enjoy it. The best part of this movie are the performances. The way the story is structured seems to lack some coherence, but it almost feels like chaos, which it makes it really feel like a newsroom. The story is based on real events, but the dialogue is made up, so keep that in mind. What I appreciated about the film is how it didn't seem to insult Republicans, rather the toxic culture of the news network. The audience is intended to sympathize with the women. The critique is mainly of Fox News, not conservatism. The tension built around Interactions with Roger Ailes is nauseating. Again, watch it if you know fox and like politics. Otherwise, you're probably not going to enjoy it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":103581,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-12-20","keywords":"fox news,photograph,scandal,sexual harassment,lesbian","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"New Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2331492121","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWEyMTkyMDAtMDkwNC00Zjk3LTk5ZGQtZmY1MTIxMGUwY2I2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWEyMTkyMDAtMDkwNC00Zjk3LTk5ZGQtZmY1MTIxMGUwY2I2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Bombshell - In theaters December 2019. programme.title: La princesse de Montpensier
La princesse de Montpensier
programme.desc:
La princesse de Montpensier: Directed by Bertrand Tavernier. With Mélanie Thierry, Lambert Wilson, Gaspard Ulliel, Grégoire Leprince-Ringuet. Based on the classic didactic novel, the action centers on the noble lady who soon becomes exposed to the sexual and political intrigues of the French court of the religious wars era." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1599975/","name":"La princesse de Montpensier","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjJiYjU5ZTctNjBlZC00OWY3LWExNzctYmI3NDgwNDBjMDdjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODIyOTEyMzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Based on the classic didactic novel, the action centers on the noble lady who soon becomes exposed to the sexual and political intrigues of the French court of the religious wars era.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1599975/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"adrean-819-339098"},"dateCreated":"2010-11-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Tavernier takes us to middle ages","reviewBody":"What I think was done very well in this film by Tavernier was the decors. Tavernier being a very gifted and talented director when faced with the challenge of recreating the middle ages succeeds like no other director in very recent memory. The exteriors, interiors and costumes are presented convincingly. He shows the nature without overdoing it. We are in the middle ages without being shown cliché after cliché.

There was one fact which may or may not be hard to swallow. I think there may be a divide amongst spectators in regards to the young cast, the exception being Lambert Wilson who in my opinion was exceptional as he was in the other film of this year Des Hommes et Des Dieux. While I could tolerate the young cast I didn't by no means fall in love with them, which could have affected my slight detachment from the action on screen. The weakest in my opinion, and I'm sure there will be some who disagree with me and they are right to do so, was the princess herself. I can't explain it but when she was on the screen I was almost at the point of irritation. Admittedly this is quite subjective and I didn't find her looks and full lips as my ideal of beauty, moreover I found her insatiable in her desires but I think I was suppose to believe she was passionate. If I didn't believe that the Princesse was a creature of passion but more-so a selfish materialist how could I fall in love with the story? Aside from minor nitpicking, I found the sparse battle scenes excellent! It was such a refreshing experience to see battles treated in this way. I almost wish there was more.

What I take from this film was a real master class in how to render a medieval world. As I predicted a director of Tavernier caliber would not get this wrong.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3895,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Action","Drama","History"],"datePublished":"2010-11-03","keywords":"literature on screen,fictional character,female frontal nudity,male rear nudity,unfaithful wife","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1610005785","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2FiNTAxODgtMGRkOC00ZTRlLWE0YzQtNzQ1NTZkMDU4N2E5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2FiNTAxODgtMGRkOC00ZTRlLWE0YzQtNzQ1NTZkMDU4N2E5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0858048/","name":"Mélanie Thierry"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0933727/","name":"Lambert Wilson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0880484/","name":"Gaspard Ulliel"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0851724/","name":"Bertrand Tavernier"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035433/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047476/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056755/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0181924/","name":"Jean Cosmos"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0478548/","name":"Madame de La Fayette"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0745930/","name":"François-Olivier Rousseau"}],"duration":"PT2H19M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 1599975, Title: La princesse de Montpensier, --- Description: La princesse de Montpensier: Directed by Bertrand Tavernier. With Mélanie Thierry, Lambert Wilson, Gaspard Ulliel, Grégoire Leprince-Ringuet. Based on the classic didactic novel, the action centers on the noble lady who soon becomes exposed to the sexual and political intrigues of the French court of the religious wars era." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1599975/","name":"La princesse de Montpensier","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjJiYjU5ZTctNjBlZC00OWY3LWExNzctYmI3NDgwNDBjMDdjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODIyOTEyMzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Based on the classic didactic novel, the action centers on the noble lady who soon becomes exposed to the sexual and political intrigues of the French court of the religious wars era.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1599975/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"adrean-819-339098","dateCreated":"2010-11-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Tavernier takes us to middle ages","reviewBody":"What I think was done very well in this film by Tavernier was the decors. Tavernier being a very gifted and talented director when faced with the challenge of recreating the middle ages succeeds like no other director in very recent memory. The exteriors, interiors and costumes are presented convincingly. He shows the nature without overdoing it. We are in the middle ages without being shown cliché after cliché.

There was one fact which may or may not be hard to swallow. I think there may be a divide amongst spectators in regards to the young cast, the exception being Lambert Wilson who in my opinion was exceptional as he was in the other film of this year Des Hommes et Des Dieux. While I could tolerate the young cast I didn't by no means fall in love with them, which could have affected my slight detachment from the action on screen. The weakest in my opinion, and I'm sure there will be some who disagree with me and they are right to do so, was the princess herself. I can't explain it but when she was on the screen I was almost at the point of irritation. Admittedly this is quite subjective and I didn't find her looks and full lips as my ideal of beauty, moreover I found her insatiable in her desires but I think I was suppose to believe she was passionate. If I didn't believe that the Princesse was a creature of passion but more-so a selfish materialist how could I fall in love with the story? Aside from minor nitpicking, I found the sparse battle scenes excellent! It was such a refreshing experience to see battles treated in this way. I almost wish there was more.

What I take from this film was a real master class in how to render a medieval world. As I predicted a director of Tavernier caliber would not get this wrong.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3895,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5,"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Action","Drama","History"],"datePublished":"2010-11-03","keywords":"literature on screen,fictional character,female frontal nudity,male rear nudity,unfaithful wife","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1610005785","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2FiNTAxODgtMGRkOC00ZTRlLWE0YzQtNzQ1NTZkMDU4N2E5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2FiNTAxODgtMGRkOC00ZTRlLWE0YzQtNzQ1NTZkMDU4N2E5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0858048/","name":"Mélanie Thierry","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0933727/","name":"Lambert Wilson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0880484/","name":"Gaspard Ulliel"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0851724/","name":"Bertrand Tavernier"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035433/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047476/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056755/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0181924/","name":"Jean Cosmos","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0478548/","name":"Madame de La Fayette","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0745930/","name":"François-Olivier Rousseau"],"duration":"PT2H19M"</script><metacontent="
