IMDb data; ttnr: 5256722, Title: Il a déjà tes yeux, --- Description: Il a déjà tes yeux: Directed by Lucien Jean-Baptiste. With Lucien Jean-Baptiste, Aïssa Maïga, Zabou Breitman, Vincent Elbaz. When French-African couple Paul and Sali discover the longed-for baby they are about to adopt is white, family chaos and confrontation ensue." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5256722/","name":"Il a déjà tes yeux","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjUwOTc5MGItZjMxYS00YTRlLTgxZWItMmZjYmNjYTA0Y2E2L2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTYzNDEyMjI@._V1_.jpg","description":"When French-African couple Paul and Sali discover the longed-for baby they are about to adopt is white, family chaos and confrontation ensue.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5256722/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"richard-fieldhouse","dateCreated":"2018-03-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Lighthearted and uplifting treatment of a serious subject","reviewBody":"This film makes a fun comedy out of the serious issue that social services tend not to be so keen on mixed race adoptions - and in this case, particularly where the baby is white.

The acting from all the cast is very strong. If I were to look for faults, I'd have to say that rather too much of the weight of inner conflict is settled on the shoulders of a single character - Claire Mallet. Doing this, I suppose, helps to keep the plot "tight", but at times it does make her motivations a little hard to accept. But don't worry. Just enjoy the story.

Unfortunately, as they get excited - which they do - the French gets a little difficult for some of us - and the subtitles start to flash up and dissappear very fast. So in terms of improving your French - this film is definitely not for beginners.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2859,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2,"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2017-01-18","keywords":"adoption,baby,couple,singing in a car,blowing out candles on a birthday cake","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2171650329","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjJiMTNiMjMtZDc3My00ZTFjLWJhMGEtZDI1NDk2ZGI5OWFiXkEyXkFqcGdeQW1haXdlbm4@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjJiMTNiMjMtZDc3My00ZTFjLWJhMGEtZDI1NDk2ZGI5OWFiXkEyXkFqcGdeQW1haXdlbm4@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0419894/","name":"Lucien Jean-Baptiste","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0563740/","name":"Aïssa Maïga","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0951456/","name":"Zabou Breitman"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0419894/","name":"Lucien Jean-Baptiste"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0405239/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0313479/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0069524/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1122105/","name":"Marie-Françoise Colombani","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1602514/","name":"Sébastien Mounier","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0419894/","name":"Lucien Jean-Baptiste"],"duration":"PT1H35M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Raising Arizona
Arizona Junior
programme.desc: Raising Arizona: Directed by Joel Coen, Ethan Coen. With Nicolas Cage, Holly Hunter, Trey Wilson, John Goodman. When a childless couple of an ex-con and an ex-cop decide to help themselves to one of another family's quintuplets, their lives become more complicated than they anticipated." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0093822/","name":"Raising Arizona","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGUwZTEwZTYtZmQ0OS00NmM1LWE2ZTQtNjZiYmE4ZmUxMjk1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a childless couple of an ex-con and an ex-cop decide to help themselves to one of another family's quintuplets, their lives become more complicated than they anticipated.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0093822/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Sandcooler"},"dateCreated":"2009-07-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Brilliant oddball comedy","reviewBody":"There are really few directors that are as consistent as the Coen brothers. Their strange sense of humour just works in every movie they make, and it's extremely fun and addictive. With that said, it's difficult to decide which of their movies is the best, but this one is a worthy contender. It's incredibly outrageous, wild and crazy, but at the same time it's close and heart-warming. It has a very surreal look, yet the emotional scenes still look very genuine, which is quite an achievement. The characters are also vintage Coen, they're all offbeat and weird, but that just raises more sympathy for them. It also helps that they all express themselves through some razor-sharp dialogues. I could barely make out the lines because I was too busy laughing at the previous lines, you wonder where these keep coming from. This movie just isn't like anything I've ever seen. It's astoundingly funny in all its weirdness.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":132762,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"1987-04-17","keywords":"arizona desert,state name in title,arizona,phoenix arizona,diaper","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"'Buster Scruggs': The Coen Bros.' Misunderstood, Misanthropic Masterwork","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2967845401","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUwNjc0MmMtYTk0MC00NTNjLWJlMzYtN2U2Njg5MjM2MjZhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFsZWxvZw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUwNjc0MmMtYTk0MC00NTNjLWJlMzYtN2U2Njg5MjM2MjZhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFsZWxvZw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"We're rootin' and tootin' about the Coen Brothers' new movie, but wasn't this supposed to be their first TV mini-series? On your IMDbrief, we look at the misunderstood, misanthropic masterwork that is, 'The Ballad of Buster Scruggs.'"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000115/","name":"Nicolas Cage"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000456/","name":"Holly Hunter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0934254/","name":"Trey Wilson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001054/","name":"Joel Coen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001053/","name":"Ethan Coen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0039098/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001053/","name":"Ethan Coen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001054/","name":"Joel Coen"}],"duration":"PT1H34M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: De l'autre côté du lit
Auf der anderen Seite des Bettes
programme.desc: De l'autre côté du lit: Directed by Pascale Pouzadoux. With Sophie Marceau, Dany Boon, Antoine Duléry, Roland Giraud. To save their marriage, a man and a woman decide to exchange their lives for a year." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1275590/","name":"De l'autre côté du lit","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGEwNTE3MzUtOWNmOS00N2Q2LWI2MDAtZGNhODI3NDM4N2U3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzQzNzQxNzI@._V1_.jpg","description":"To save their marriage, a man and a woman decide to exchange their lives for a year.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1275590/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"aleena_m"},"dateCreated":"2012-03-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Take it for what it is","reviewBody":"Before deciding if I want to see a movie or not, I usually do 2 things: I check out the IMDb vote and I see the trailer. To tell you the truth I did this quite a long time ago for this one, so I looked at the vote again before hitting the play button. You can imagine that my expectations were quite low: a 5.2 out of 10 isn't that much and the 3 reviews out there were so critical. I decided to see it anyway imagining that I will at least have a different experience given that the movies I normally watch are Hollywood productions. I must say I actually enjoyed it! I took it as a comedy, not as a documentary! I saw people were complaining about the fact that the situations were highly unlikely or that the movie was inspired from a book and it didn't do it justice. Well movies rarely succeed in doing that as far as I know... Books and movies are 2 distinct experiences! I liked the fact that there was little or no vulgarity and a complete lack of fart/bodily fluids/coarse sex jokes that I see too often! I don't find those funny! It's way more difficult to make people laugh because of funny circumstances or truly intelligent or sarcastic lines! To wrap it up without giving anything away, take it as a light-hearted comedy and don't have too high expectations - you might actually enjoy it ;)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2584,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2009-01-07","keywords":"role reversal,switched identity,f rated,singing in a car,family relationships","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000521/","name":"Sophie Marceau"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0200702/","name":"Dany Boon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0241383/","name":"Antoine Duléry"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0693903/","name":"Pascale Pouzadoux"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0233587/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0079764/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0257823/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3248435/","name":"Alix Girod de l'Ain"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0693903/","name":"Pascale Pouzadoux"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0897065/","name":"Grégoire Vigneron"}],"duration":"PT1H33M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: It Could Happen to You
Zwei Millionen Dollar Trinkgeld
programme.desc:
It Could Happen to You: Directed by Andrew Bergman. With Nicolas Cage, Bridget Fonda, Rosie Perez, Wendell Pierce. A police officer promises to share his lottery ticket with a waitress in lieu of a tip." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0110167/","name":"It Could Happen to You","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzMxOGUzOWEtMGUxMi00ZWM1LWE3ODgtNzc4OGVjZmJhMmFmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODY0NzcxNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A police officer promises to share his lottery ticket with a waitress in lieu of a tip.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0110167/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Kinitawowi"},"dateCreated":"2002-06-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"The nearest any film's ever come to breaking me...","reviewBody":"...as a cynic.

I, through whatever reason, am absurdly cynical. A cynic, lest we forget, is somebody who puts very little faith in the good nature of humanity. Somebody who considers all good deeds to be selfishly motivated.

Somebody who should absolutely hate this film.

But I can't. I love this to pieces. No film has ever done as much to give me some faith in people. If Charlie can do the decent thing and split his ticket with Yvonne to fulfil a promise, despite the demands of a furious Muriel; if despite reaching a financial and emotional low they can still invite Angel in to put some food in his belly; and if the New York public can show their appreciation by doing whatever little they can to help out; then maybe, just maybe, there might be hope for the rest of us.

This. Is. IMDb data; ttnr: 0110167, Title: It Could Happen to You, --- Description: It Could Happen to You: Directed by Andrew Bergman. With Nicolas Cage, Bridget Fonda, Rosie Perez, Wendell Pierce. A police officer promises to share his lottery ticket with a waitress in lieu of a tip." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0110167/","name":"It Could Happen to You","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzMxOGUzOWEtMGUxMi00ZWM1LWE3ODgtNzc4OGVjZmJhMmFmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODY0NzcxNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A police officer promises to share his lottery ticket with a waitress in lieu of a tip.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0110167/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Kinitawowi","dateCreated":"2002-06-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"The nearest any film's ever come to breaking me...","reviewBody":"...as a cynic.

I, through whatever reason, am absurdly cynical. A cynic, lest we forget, is somebody who puts very little faith in the good nature of humanity. Somebody who considers all good deeds to be selfishly motivated.

Somebody who should absolutely hate this film.

But I can't. I love this to pieces. No film has ever done as much to give me some faith in people. If Charlie can do the decent thing and split his ticket with Yvonne to fulfil a promise, despite the demands of a furious Muriel; if despite reaching a financial and emotional low they can still invite Angel in to put some food in his belly; and if the New York public can show their appreciation by doing whatever little they can to help out; then maybe, just maybe, there might be hope for the rest of us.

This. Is. Beautiful.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":37935,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1994-07-29","keywords":"hot air balloon,generosity,lottery,waitress,winning the lottery","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"It Could Happen to You","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1269760281","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTg2MmJjM2ItMTM5Ny00NTBlLTk3ZTQtNzFiOWRhZWNlNDAwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTg2MmJjM2ItMTM5Ny00NTBlLTk3ZTQtNzFiOWRhZWNlNDAwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000115/","name":"Nicolas Cage","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000403/","name":"Bridget Fonda","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001609/","name":"Rosie Perez"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000921/","name":"Andrew Bergman"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005883/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0026862/","name":"Jane Anderson"],"duration":"PT1H41M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Save Yourselves
Save Yourselves!
programme.desc:
Save Yourselves!: Directed by Alex Huston Fischer, Eleanor Wilson. With Sunita Mani, John Reynolds, Ben Sinclair, John Early. A young Brooklyn couple heads to an upstate cabin to unplug from their phones and reconnect with each other. Blissfully unaware of their surroundings, they are left to their own devices as the planet falls under attack." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7873348/","name":"Save Yourselves!","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjZhYzkwMzQtOWMyZi00NTJmLWFjNGEtYzAzNzJhNDZhMmQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDY2MjcyOTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young Brooklyn couple heads to an upstate cabin to unplug from their phones and reconnect with each other. Blissfully unaware of their surroundings, they are left to their own devices as the planet falls under attack.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7873348/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"paul-allaer"},"dateCreated":"2020-10-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"When the world goes poof!","reviewBody":""Save Yourselves!" (2020 release; 93 min.) brings the story of John and Sue, a couple in Brooklyn. As the movie opens, they are bickering about computer and smart phone time. After attending a party where a friend offers his renovated updated cabin for free for a week, John and Sue eagerly take up the offer, and furthermore, they decide to disconnect from their phones and computers... At this point we are 10 min. into the film but to tell you more of the plot would spoil your viewing experience, you'll just have to see for yourself how it all plays out.

Couple of comments: this small-budget indie movie was written and directed by Alex Huston Fischer and Eleanor Wilson, this being their feature length debut. The story is the umpteenth reimagination of what "the end of the world" might look like, but they bring it with an original twist that I will not give away. Watch the film and the title of my review will make all the sense in the world. Sunita Mani (as Sue) and John Reynolds (as Jack), best known for their respective TV work, are enjoyable in the lead roles. They are in just about every frame of the film, and for long stretches it's just them. This film is billed as a scifi comedy, and I suppose it is. But I must be honest: rarely laughed (and certainly not out loud). The film lacks gravitas to be taken seriously, but it also lacks truly funny moments to work as a comedy. Instead what we get is an off-center indie film that is more quirky than anything else.

"Save Yourselves!" opened this weekend at my local art-house theater here in Cincinnati, of course fully adhering to all COVID-19 social distancing and other protocols. Not that it matter much, as the Friday early evening screening where I saw this at was attended poorly: exactly 3 people (including myself) in the theater's largest room. I honestly don't know how this and other theaters can keep operating like this on a profitable basis. Meanwhile, if you have any interest in an atypical "end of the world" scifi comedy, I'd readily suggest you check this out , be it in the theater, on VOD, or eventually on DVD/Blu-ray, and draw your own conclusion.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":6042,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2020-10-02","keywords":"couple,cabin,cell phone,woods,planet earth","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Sci-Fi Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi447594777","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmZmY2VlMjEtOTI5OS00MDUxLTgwODItNTY4NjY3ZmQ5NDAzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmZmY2VlMjEtOTI5OS00MDUxLTgwODItNTY4NjY3ZmQ5NDAzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4576371/","name":"Sunita Mani"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6324745/","name":"John Reynolds"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4161154/","name":"Ben Sinclair"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7742589/","name":"Alex Huston Fischer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2856727/","name":"Eleanor Wilson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0392734/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0724160/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0092503/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7742589/","name":"Alex Huston Fischer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2856727/","name":"Eleanor Wilson"}],"duration":"PT1H33M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Valentine's Day
Valentinstag
programme.desc: Valentine's Day: Directed by Garry Marshall. With Jessica Alba, Kathy Bates, Jessica Biel, Bradley Cooper. Intertwining couples and singles in Los Angeles break-up and make-up based on the pressures and expectations of Valentine's Day." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0817230/","name":"Valentine's Day","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk3MTIwNDIxNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDMyMzcwMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Intertwining couples and singles in Los Angeles break-up and make-up based on the pressures and expectations of Valentine's Day.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0817230/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mchael_skunk"},"dateCreated":"2010-02-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"cheesy rom-com","reviewBody":"Valentine's Day is a who's who of famous people, a very Hollywood romance movie with a severe case of A.D.D. Most stars check in as if paying back some favour to the director. It is a people movie full of people for the Facebook generation. Is it serious film-making? Well, it's one of those films that has bloopers during the credits, so definitely not; so we shouldn't judge it on that. It's simply a schmaltzy whimsical chick flick. The film takes place over one fine Valentine's Day from early morning to late at night in flawless Hollywood California. We follow random individuals, who are each connected within 5 degrees of each other, as they deal with love. The movie has been marketed as being choc-block full of superstars, so lets see how they did. Kathy Bates has two scenes, I completely forgot she was in it until the second time she popped up, She is very likable as the butch TV News executive who is the boss of career driven Kelvin Moore (Jamie Foxx), a B-Grade sports commentator trying to make his mark, but given a vox-pops job. Foxx seems way too charming to be such an unlikeable character, as publicist Kara (Jessica Biel) slowly falls for him, but we're not really given enough time as we cut to florist Reed (Ashton Kutcher) a hopeless romantic who has fallen for Morley (Jessica Alba), and Julia (Jennifer Garner) in a 30-something love triangle. Garner is a teacher at a primary school where young Edison (Bryce Robinson) has his first crush, and desperately tries to send his mystery girl a special delivery. Robinson brings the cute to this movie, and holds his own against the army of celebrities he's acting with, namely Shirley MacLaine as Edison's grandmother, Estelle. Estelle is a Golden Age Actress, (MacLaine playing herself, as we see from actual footage of MacLaine in 1958's Hot Spell) who is in a fifty year marriage with Edgar (Hector Elizondo). Both performances are top notch, Elizondo arguably the best in the entire film. He is soulful, gentle, and wise. For the teens, the majority market, we have Grace and Alex (Emma Roberts and Carter Jenkins) awkwardly trying to plan the next level of their relationship in scenes right out of the American Pie book on how to write teen comedy, and Willy and Felicia (Taylor Lautner and Taylor Swift) the jock and the bimbo, who 13 to 19 year old girls will literally cheer at the screen for, yet they bring little. Swift is cringe-worthy and Lautner makes an out of place reference to his abs that is just odd in the context of the film. We also have Liz (Anne Hathaway in a solid enough comedic performance, she does funny voices) who moonlights as a phone sex operator, and hides this from boyfriend of two weeks Jason (Topher Grace, slighty less annoying than usual). Also thrown into the mix is McDreamy as the cheating swine Dr. Harrison Copeland, and McSteamy as ageing single footballer Sean Jackson. Stuck on a plane are Holden and Captain Kate Hazeltine (Bradley Cooper, and Julia Roberts), as they meet, and chat, and flirt, and seem like those two old grumpy muppets in the booth. Queen Latifah also features as Liz's evil boss Paula Thomas who delivers the biggest laugh in the movie, right at the end. Alphonso (George Lopez) also stars as Kutcher's co-worker and go-to-guy for the Valentine's Day blues. Every actor does a good enough job of playing movie versions of themselves and no one tries to steal the show or go over the top crazy, but the amount of stars in the movie work both for it and against it. It is a very unique romance film, and is good for people who are likely to get sick of the same two actors, but we really don't see enough of anyone to care, or even follow what's going on. Characters are thrown at us, and before we have a moment to connect, we cut to someone else, and this happens for two straight hours as love, romance, sex, and relationships are examined and theorized. It's like a fish bowl with way too many fish, but we get to see characters just enough to get a laugh or two in. The film tries to find the true meaning of Valentine's Day, and the true meaning of love, in a cutesy comedic way. It's modern and fun, but very shallow on the surface.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":116859,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2010-02-10","keywords":"grandmother grandson relationship,grandfather grandson relationship,car,barefoot male,man wrapped in a towel","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Valentine's Day -- International Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2244215833","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA4NTY5NzEyMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjk3ODYzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA4NTY5NzEyMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjk3ODYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Intertwining couples and singles in Los Angeles break-up and make-up based on the pressures and expectations of Valentine's Day."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000210/","name":"Julia Roberts"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004937/","name":"Jamie Foxx"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004266/","name":"Anne Hathaway"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005190/","name":"Garry Marshall"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046718/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0176486/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033868/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0297545/","name":"Katherine Fugate"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0463359/","name":"Abby Kohn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0799050/","name":"Marc Silverstein"}],"duration":"PT2H5M"}</script><metacontent="

Stuck on a plane are Holden and Captain Kate Hazeltine (Bradley Cooper, and Julia Roberts), as they meet, and chat, and flirt, and seem like those two old grumpy muppets in the booth. Queen Latifah also features as Liz's evil boss Paula Thomas who delivers the biggest laugh in the movie, right at the end. Alphonso (George Lopez) also stars as Kutcher's co-worker and go-to-guy for the Valentine's Day blues. Every actor does a good enough job of playing movie versions of themselves and no one tries to steal the show or go over the top crazy, but the amount of stars in the movie work both for it and against it. It is a very unique romance film, and is good for people who are likely to get sick of the same two actors, but we really don't see enough of anyone to care, or even follow what's going on. Characters are thrown at us, and before we have a moment to connect, we cut to someone else, and this happens for two straight hours as love, romance, sex, and relationships are examined and theorized. It's like a fish bowl with way too many fish, but we get to see characters just enough to get a laugh or two in. The film tries to find the true meaning of Valentine's Day, and the true meaning of love, in a cutesy comedic way. It's modern and fun, but very shallow on the surface.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":116859,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2010-02-10","keywords":"grandmother grandson relationship,grandfather grandson relationship,car,barefoot male,man wrapped in a towel","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Valentine's Day -- International Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2244215833","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA4NTY5NzEyMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjk3ODYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA4NTY5NzEyMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjk3ODYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Intertwining couples and singles in Los Angeles break-up and make-up based on the pressures and expectations of Valentine's Day.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000210/","name":"Julia Roberts","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004937/","name":"Jamie Foxx","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004266/","name":"Anne Hathaway"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005190/","name":"Garry Marshall"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046718/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0176486/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033868/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0297545/","name":"Katherine Fugate","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0463359/","name":"Abby Kohn","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0799050/","name":"Marc Silverstein"],"duration":"PT2H5M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Fack ju Göhte 3
Fack Ju Göhte 3
programme.desc: Fack ju Göhte 3: Directed by Bora Dagtekin. With Elyas M'Barek, Katja Riemann, Jella Haase, Sandra Hüller. A bank robber becomes a teacher after being released from prison and finds himself at the center of a number of crazy adventures." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6471264/","name":"Fack ju Göhte 3","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjlkYWJjZDItNzA2OS00ZWZjLTg4NmItNWRjMjJjNTZlODU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjQ3NzUxOTM@._V1_.jpg","description":"A bank robber becomes a teacher after being released from prison and finds himself at the center of a number of crazy adventures.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6471264/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Breumaster"},"dateCreated":"2020-02-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Too Much Over the Top","reviewBody":"The movie has some funny scenes, but also too much gross-out humour. It wouldn't be that, if it wasn't so over the top trying to be funny. On the other hand I do admire, that German movie makers at last try to come out having gut to go better ways. The main problem with Germans movie business is, that they always try to do a movie that has a deeper meaning - and then the movies become boring, except those movies about the second world war. I consider this as a new attempt to bring freshness into German cinema. Not the worst, not the best. I hope they keep the way and will be better in next productions. The movie itself tells, that this is the last part of this series. I hope the next projects will be less hectic and over-excited, but better - in a new way.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5440,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2017-10-26","keywords":"singing in a car,female teacher,teacher student relationship,teacher student conflict,munich germany","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4153260825","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTBhZGNlYTctYmYxYi00YmU2LTlhMDItN2E0ZjRjNzU4NmNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTBhZGNlYTctYmYxYi00YmU2LTlhMDItN2E0ZjRjNzU4NmNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1065929/","name":"Elyas M'Barek"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0726257/","name":"Katja Riemann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3436464/","name":"Jella Haase"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1480916/","name":"Bora Dagtekin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002257/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1480916/","name":"Bora Dagtekin"}],"duration":"PT2H"}</script><metacontent="

Die Schönste Zeit unseres Lebens
programme.desc: La Belle Époque: Directed by Nicolas Bedos. With Daniel Auteuil, Guillaume Canet, Doria Tillier, Fanny Ardant. A couple in crisis. He, disillusioned, sees his life upset the day an entrepreneur offers him to plunge back into the time of his choice." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9172422/","name":"La Belle Époque","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTMzZjA2ZmMtZWMyMS00MWMxLTljYjktMWUzYjE0ZWNiY2RkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODIyOTEyMzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A couple in crisis. He, disillusioned, sees his life upset the day an entrepreneur offers him to plunge back into the time of his choice.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9172422/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"chbrasso"},"dateCreated":"2019-10-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"A funny, thought provoking trip to the 1970's","reviewBody":"Just saw this film at the VIFF. Victor also was excellent playing the down and out jilted husband seeking connection to his past. programme.title: De l'autre côté du lit

programme.desc: De l'autre côté du lit: Directed by Pascale Pouzadoux. With Sophie Marceau, Dany Boon, Antoine Duléry, Roland Giraud. To save their marriage, a man and a woman decide to exchange their lives for a year." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1275590/","name":"De l'autre côté du lit","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGEwNTE3MzUtOWNmOS00N2Q2LWI2MDAtZGNhODI3NDM4N2U3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzQzNzQxNzI@._V1_.jpg","description":"To save their marriage, a man and a woman decide to exchange their lives for a year.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1275590/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"aleena_m"},"dateCreated":"2012-03-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Take it for what it is","reviewBody":"Before deciding if I want to see a movie or not, I usually do 2 things: I check out the IMDb vote and I see the trailer. To tell you the truth I did this quite a long time ago for this one, so I looked at the vote again before hitting the play button. You can imagine that my expectations were quite low: a 5.2 out of 10 isn't that much and the 3 reviews out there were so critical. I decided to see it anyway imagining that I will at least have a different experience given that the movies I normally watch are Hollywood productions. I must say I actually enjoyed it! I took it as a comedy, not as a documentary! I saw people were complaining about the fact that the situations were highly unlikely or that the movie was inspired from a book and it didn't do it justice. Well movies rarely succeed in doing that as far as I know... Books and movies are 2 distinct experiences! I liked the fact that there was little or no vulgarity and a complete lack of fart/bodily fluids/coarse sex jokes that I see too often! I don't find those funny! It's way more difficult to make people laugh because of funny circumstances or truly intelligent or sarcastic lines! To wrap it up without giving anything away, take it as a light-hearted comedy and don't have too high expectations - you might actually enjoy it ;)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2584,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2009-01-07","keywords":"role reversal,switched identity,f rated,singing in a car,family relationships","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000521/","name":"Sophie Marceau"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0200702/","name":"Dany Boon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0241383/","name":"Antoine Duléry"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0693903/","name":"Pascale Pouzadoux"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0233587/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0079764/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0257823/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3248435/","name":"Alix Girod de l'Ain"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0693903/","name":"Pascale Pouzadoux"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0897065/","name":"Grégoire Vigneron"}],"duration":"PT1H33M"}</script><metacontent="

Zwei Millionen Dollar Trinkgeld
programme.desc:
It Could Happen to You: Directed by Andrew Bergman. With Nicolas Cage, Bridget Fonda, Rosie Perez, Wendell Pierce. A police officer promises to share his lottery ticket with a waitress in lieu of a tip." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0110167/","name":"It Could Happen to You","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzMxOGUzOWEtMGUxMi00ZWM1LWE3ODgtNzc4OGVjZmJhMmFmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODY0NzcxNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A police officer promises to share his lottery ticket with a waitress in lieu of a tip.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0110167/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Kinitawowi"},"dateCreated":"2002-06-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"The nearest any film's ever come to breaking me...","reviewBody":"...as a cynic.

I, through whatever reason, am absurdly cynical. A cynic, lest we forget, is somebody who puts very little faith in the good nature of humanity. Somebody who considers all good deeds to be selfishly motivated.

Somebody who should absolutely hate this film.

But I can't. I love this to pieces. No film has ever done as much to give me some faith in people. If Charlie can do the decent thing and split his ticket with Yvonne to fulfil a promise, despite the demands of a furious Muriel; if despite reaching a financial and emotional low they can still invite Angel in to put some food in his belly; and if the New York public can show their appreciation by doing whatever little they can to help out; then maybe, just maybe, there might be hope for the rest of us.

This. Is. Beautiful.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":37935,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1994-07-29","keywords":"hot air balloon,generosity,lottery,waitress,winning the lottery","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"It Could Happen to You","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1269760281","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTg2MmJjM2ItMTM5Ny00NTBlLTk3ZTQtNzFiOWRhZWNlNDAwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTg2MmJjM2ItMTM5Ny00NTBlLTk3ZTQtNzFiOWRhZWNlNDAwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000115/","name":"Nicolas Cage"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000403/","name":"Bridget Fonda"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001609/","name":"Rosie Perez"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000921/","name":"Andrew Bergman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005883/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0026862/","name":"Jane Anderson"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: American Pie 2
American Pie 2
programme.desc:
American Pie 2: Directed by J.B. Rogers. With Jason Biggs, Shannon Elizabeth, Alyson Hannigan, Chris Klein. Jim and his friends are now in college, and they decide to meet up at the beach house for some fun." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0252866/","name":"American Pie 2","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTEyYjhiMjYtNjU3YS00NmQ4LTlhNTEtYTczNWY3MGJmNzE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Jim and his friends are now in college, and they decide to meet up at the beach house for some fun.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0252866/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mattymatt4ever"},"dateCreated":"2002-02-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Decent sequel","reviewBody":"I saw the movie in theaters and laughed out loud. Now, I rented the DVD. I can't say I got as many laughs as the first time, though, and I started to notice more flaws. At first I thought this movie was better than the original. Now I'm not sure. They both have great redeeming qualities that pretty much balance the scale.

The two films movie at a similar rhythm. In the original, we opened with Jim's Dad walking in on him while masturbating. In the sequel, he walks in on him while he's having sex, only it's taken to the next level with the girlfriend's parents walking in as well. And we have the keg party, with a Steadicam shot following Stiffler around, who yet again gets into a mishap with bodily fluids. And of course, in homage of the famous Nadia scene from the original, we have the guys walking in on two lesbians.

 The laughs are still there, and there are some genuinely funny moments. I don't want to give them away, though the previews and some of the other reviewers probably already did.

The cast still got it. Eugene Levy steals the show yet again as Jim's Dad. I do have to say, Stiffler's character got a little too obnoxious at times. It's often funny to hear his foul-mouthed insults, but by the hundredth time you hear him use the word "f**kface" it gets kinda old.

 I'm always going to hold the "American Pie" movies several notches above the standard gross-out teen comedies, because they have zest and originality. Not to mention they're done in a professional manner. The gags are as intelligent as they are crude, and delivered with exquisite timing. And to top it off, it's a heartfelt film that is not literally all about getting laid. I thought the original had more heart to it, but the sequel also has its heart in the right place.

The music is great. The soundtrack is full of really cool songs, including "Smooth Criminal" by Alien Ant Farm. And be sure to check out the unrated DVD special edition. The commentary is cool and--unlike with the first "American Pie" unrated edition--there is some bonus footage worth checking out. The lesbian scene is extended significantly. In the theatrical version, there was only a brief nudity, but you get to see much more in this version.

I'm still not sure if I would consider this movie better than the first, but it is one sequel that lives up to the original--and that's saying a lot!

My score: 7 (out of 10)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":247435,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2001-08-10","keywords":"coitus,female nudity,college student,reference to safe sex,female removes her clothes","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"American Pie 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4043966233","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGJlNzYzY2YtOWM5MS00M2U1LWE4OTItZTQwYjVkNDY0MWUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGJlNzYzY2YtOWM5MS00M2U1LWE4OTItZTQwYjVkNDY0MWUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Teaser trailer for this comedy follow up"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004755/","name":"Jason Biggs"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005405/","name":"Seann William Scott"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002436/","name":"Shannon Elizabeth"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0736930/","name":"J.B. IMDb data; ttnr: 0252866, Title: American Pie 2, --- Description: American Pie 2: Directed by J.B. Rogers. With Jason Biggs, Shannon Elizabeth, Alyson Hannigan, Chris Klein. Jim and his friends are now in college, and they decide to meet up at the beach house for some fun." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0252866/","name":"American Pie 2","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTEyYjhiMjYtNjU3YS00NmQ4LTlhNTEtYTczNWY3MGJmNzE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Jim and his friends are now in college, and they decide to meet up at the beach house for some fun.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0252866/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"mattymatt4ever","dateCreated":"2002-02-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Decent sequel","reviewBody":"I saw the movie in theaters and laughed out loud. Now, I rented the DVD. I can't say I got as many laughs as the first time, though, and I started to notice more flaws. At first I thought this movie was better than the original. Now I'm not sure. They both have great redeeming qualities that pretty much balance the scale.

The two films movie at a similar rhythm. In the original, we opened with Jim's Dad walking in on him while masturbating. In the sequel, he walks in on him while he's having sex, only it's taken to the next level with the girlfriend's parents walking in as well. And we have the keg party, with a Steadicam shot following Stiffler around, who yet again gets into a mishap with bodily fluids. And of course, in homage of the famous Nadia scene from the original, we have the guys walking in on two lesbians.

 The laughs are still there, and there are some genuinely funny moments. I don't want to give them away, though the previews and some of the other reviewers probably already did.

The cast still got it. Eugene Levy steals the show yet again as Jim's Dad. I do have to say, Stiffler's character got a little too obnoxious at times. It's often funny to hear his foul-mouthed insults, but by the hundredth time you hear him use the word "f**kface" it gets kinda old.

 I'm always going to hold the "American Pie" movies several notches above the standard gross-out teen comedies, because they have zest and originality. Not to mention they're done in a professional manner. The gags are as intelligent as they are crude, and delivered with exquisite timing. And to top it off, it's a heartfelt film that is not literally all about getting laid. I thought the original had more heart to it, but the sequel also has its heart in the right place.

The music is great. The soundtrack is full of really cool songs, including "Smooth Criminal" by Alien Ant Farm. And be sure to check out the unrated DVD special edition. The commentary is cool and--unlike with the first "American Pie" unrated edition--there is some bonus footage worth checking out. The lesbian scene is extended significantly. In the theatrical version, there was only a brief nudity, but you get to see much more in this version.

I'm still not sure if I would consider this movie better than the first, but it is one sequel that lives up to the original--and that's saying a lot!

It's the wedding of Jim and Michelle and the gathering of their families and friends, including Jim's old friends from high school and Michelle's little sister." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0328828/","name":"American Wedding","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTAwNTIzNDk1MDVeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU3MDMwNzAwMDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"It's the wedding of Jim and Michelle and the gathering of their families and friends, including Jim's old friends from high school and Michelle's little sister.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0328828/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"StanMakitadonuts"},"dateCreated":"2007-01-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"the final chapter","reviewBody":"This was an awesome closure to the American pie series (with the original cast) Stifler is pretty good in this, he always steps it up. The cast kinda gets smaller and smaller as the series goes on, but we are left with the core of the group. Jim again has some great comedic moments, Jason Biggs by now has perfected the role of Jim. This as the second movie, plays it's part as a sequel, series or a trilogy. If you have seen the first two, this will be a good ending to the story for those who haven't seen the first two, or only part one, go out and get caught up before seeing this one. You missed a lot of the action. icing on the cake\n\n9/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":200292,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2003-08-01","keywords":"wedding,bachelor party,sex comedy,wedding ring,resort hotel","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"American Wedding","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2478178585","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWY0NjYwYzItODM4ZC00NmYxLTgwYTYtOWU0MTAyMzkyMzdhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWY0NjYwYzItODM4ZC00NmYxLTgwYTYtOWU0MTAyMzkyMzdhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Universal Studios Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004755/","name":"Jason Biggs"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004989/","name":"Alyson Hannigan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005405/","name":"Seann William Scott"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0245888/","name":"Jesse Dylan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0100462/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033633/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0381221/","name":"Adam Herz"}],"duration":"PT1H36M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: American Reunion
American Pie – Das Klassentreffen
programme.desc: American Reunion: Directed by Jon Hurwitz, Hayden Schlossberg. With Jason Biggs, Alyson Hannigan, Chris Klein, Thomas Ian Nicholas. Jim, Michelle, Stifler, and their friends reunite in East Great Falls, Michigan for their high school reunion." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1605630/","name":"American Reunion","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY4MTEyMzU1N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDQ0NTc1Nw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Jim, Michelle, Stifler, and their friends reunite in East Great Falls, Michigan for their high school reunion.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1605630/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jsummers88"},"dateCreated":"2012-03-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Welcome Return","reviewBody":"My school was handing out tickets for a special screening for American Reunion tonight, I just got back from the screening. I was never a die hard fan of the American Pie series, but I've always found them to be quite enjoyable. I still feel the same way when I was watching this film. I'll be honest, I thought this one wasn't going to be any good and I thought it would be toned down, I'm glad to be wrong this time around. I'm not going to go much into the plot except that it's simply a reunion as all the characters are here to return, which it what you'd expect coming into this. It's just as sweet and crude as the previous three. Just like the other films, Seann William Scott is still the best part of the film. The rest of the cast did just as good as they did with the previous films. If you're a fan of the previous films, you'll still find something to enjoy. If you never were a fan, this isn't going to change your mind.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":208330,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2012-04-11","keywords":"high school reunion,outdoor sex,upskirt,thong,panties","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"No. 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3984040217","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjcxNzc1MTM2Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTY5NjQyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjcxNzc1MTM2Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTY5NjQyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Jim, Michelle, Stifler, and their friends reunite in East Great Falls, Michigan for their high school reunion."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004755/","name":"Jason Biggs"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004989/","name":"Alyson Hannigan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005405/","name":"Seann William Scott"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1375358/","name":"Jon Hurwitz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1376383/","name":"Hayden Schlossberg"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0172687/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1375358/","name":"Jon Hurwitz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1376383/","name":"Hayden Schlossberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0381221/","name":"Adam Herz"}],"duration":"PT1H53M"}</script><metacontent="

Enjoyable movie and worth your time.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":14687,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2020-10-16","keywords":"secretary,detective,bar,voice over narration,teenager","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Kid Detective [Trailer]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3983655193","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzcyMWU2NDItNjAzZS00NGMzLWIzODUtNGM0YWY3ZGYwMDg0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzcyMWU2NDItNjAzZS00NGMzLWIzODUtNGM0YWY3ZGYwMDg0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A once-celebrated kid detective (Adam Brody), now 31, continues to solve the same trivial mysteries between hangovers and bouts of self-pity. Until a naïve client (Sophie Nélisse) brings him his first adult case - to find out who brutally murdered her boyfriend.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10596532/","name":"Kaitlyn Chalmers-Rizzato","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0111013/","name":"Adam Brody","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7386306/","name":"Kaleb Horn"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2530291/","name":"Evan Morgan"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0383512/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0496439/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2530291/","name":"Evan Morgan"],"duration":"PT1H40M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Valentine's Day
Valentinstag
programme.desc: Valentine's Day: Directed by Garry Marshall. With Jessica Alba, Kathy Bates, Jessica Biel, Bradley Cooper. Intertwining couples and singles in Los Angeles break-up and make-up based on the pressures and expectations of Valentine's Day." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0817230/","name":"Valentine's Day","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk3MTIwNDIxNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDMyMzcwMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Intertwining couples and singles in Los Angeles break-up and make-up based on the pressures and expectations of Valentine's Day.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0817230/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mchael_skunk"},"dateCreated":"2010-02-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"cheesy rom-com","reviewBody":"Valentine's Day is a who's who of famous people, a very Hollywood romance movie with a severe case of A.D.D. Most stars check in as if paying back some favour to the director. It is a people movie full of people for the Facebook generation. Is it serious film-making? Well, it's one of those films that has bloopers during the credits, so definitely not; so we shouldn't judge it on that. It's simply a schmaltzy whimsical chick flick. The film takes place over one fine Valentine's Day from early morning to late at night in flawless Hollywood California. We follow random individuals, who are each connected within 5 degrees of each other, as they deal with love. The movie has been marketed as being choc-block full of superstars, so lets see how they did. Kathy Bates has two scenes, I completely forgot she was in it until the second time she popped up, She is very likable as the butch TV News executive who is the boss of career driven Kelvin Moore (Jamie Foxx), a B-Grade sports commentator trying to make his mark, but given a vox-pops job. Foxx seems way too charming to be such an unlikeable character, as publicist Kara (Jessica Biel) slowly falls for him, but we're not really given enough time as we cut to florist Reed (Ashton Kutcher) a hopeless romantic who has fallen for Morley (Jessica Alba), and Julia (Jennifer Garner) in a 30-something love triangle. Garner is a teacher at a primary school where young Edison (Bryce Robinson) has his first crush, and desperately tries to send his mystery girl a special delivery. Robinson brings the cute to this movie, and holds his own against the army of celebrities he's acting with, namely Shirley MacLaine as Edison's grandmother, Estelle. Estelle is a Golden Age Actress, (MacLaine playing herself, as we see from actual footage of MacLaine in 1958's Hot Spell) who is in a fifty year marriage with Edgar (Hector Elizondo). Both performances are top notch, Elizondo arguably the best in the entire film. He is soulful, gentle, and wise. For the teens, the majority market, we have Grace and Alex (Emma Roberts and Carter Jenkins) awkwardly trying to plan the next level of their relationship in scenes right out of the American Pie book on how to write teen comedy, and Willy and Felicia (Taylor Lautner and Taylor Swift) the jock and the bimbo, who 13 to 19 year old girls will literally cheer at the screen for, yet they bring little. Swift is cringe-worthy and Lautner makes an out of place reference to his abs that is just odd in the context of the film. We also have Liz (Anne Hathaway in a solid enough comedic performance, she does funny voices) who moonlights as a phone sex operator, and hides this from boyfriend of two weeks Jason (Topher Grace, slighty less annoying than usual). Also thrown into the mix is McDreamy as the cheating swine Dr. Harrison Copeland, and McSteamy as ageing single footballer Sean Jackson. Stuck on a plane are Holden and Captain Kate Hazeltine (Bradley Cooper, and Julia Roberts), as they meet, and chat, and flirt, and seem like those two old grumpy muppets in the booth. Queen Latifah also features as Liz's evil boss Paula Thomas who delivers the biggest laugh in the movie, right at the end. Alphonso (George Lopez) also stars as Kutcher's co-worker and go-to-guy for the Valentine's Day blues. Every actor does a good enough job of playing movie versions of themselves and no one tries to steal the show or go over the top crazy, but the amount of stars in the movie work both for it and against it. It is a very unique romance film, and is good for people who are likely to get sick of the same two actors, but we really don't see enough of anyone to care, or even follow what's going on. Characters are thrown at us, and before we have a moment to connect, we cut to someone else, and this happens for two straight hours as love, romance, sex, and relationships are examined and theorized. It's like a fish bowl with way too many fish, but we get to see characters just enough to get a laugh or two in. The film tries to find the true meaning of Valentine's Day, and the true meaning of love, in a cutesy comedic way. It's modern and fun, but very shallow on the surface.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":116859,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2010-02-10","keywords":"grandmother grandson relationship,grandfather grandson relationship,car,barefoot male,man wrapped in a towel","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Valentine's Day -- International Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2244215833","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA4NTY5NzEyMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjk3ODYzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA4NTY5NzEyMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjk3ODYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Intertwining couples and singles in Los Angeles break-up and make-up based on the pressures and expectations of Valentine's Day."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000210/","name":"Julia Roberts"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004937/","name":"Jamie Foxx"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004266/","name":"Anne Hathaway"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005190/","name":"Garry Marshall"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046718/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0176486/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033868/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0297545/","name":"Katherine Fugate"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0463359/","name":"Abby Kohn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0799050/","name":"Marc Silverstein"}],"duration":"PT2H5M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Unfinished Business
Big Business – Ausser Spesen nichts gewesen
programme.desc:
Unfinished Business: Directed by Ken Scott. With Vince Vaughn, Tom Wilkinson, Dave Franco, Sienna Miller. A hard-working small business owner and his two associates travel to Europe to close the most important deal of their lives. But what began as a routine business trip goes off the rails in every way imaginable, and unimaginable." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2358925/","name":"Unfinished Business","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGMwYjc3ZWEtNjMxNS00MzdkLWEwYWQtYWRkMDUwZWRhMjE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDk3NzU2MTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A hard-working small business owner and his two associates travel to Europe to close the most important deal of their lives. But what began as a routine business trip goes off the rails in every way imaginable, and unimaginable.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2358925/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"phd_travel"},"dateCreated":"2015-09-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not that bad a funny premise and a good cast.","reviewBody":"Don't listen to all the negative news about this comedy. It's not that bad. This comedy is funny in parts and the cast is well chosen. The small start up vs established corporation is quite relevant and amusing today. The team is funny with the retirement age guy (Tom Wilkinson), the newbie dimwit (Dave Franco who is great at this kind of role) and Vince as the guy struggling to get his new business going. Sienna Miller is pretty and does the ---hole boss well. James Marsden is good as the corporate schmuck. The filming in Berlin is fun to watch with it's mix of old and new and cutting edge. The side plot of Vince's kid being bullied for being fat is a bit overdone. Of course there are some crude moments like any comedy these days with it's nudity.

Overall worth one watch.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":33046,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2015-04-08","keywords":"male nudity,business trip,company,glory hole,businessman","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1415687705","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA1MzkxOTAxN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODgyMTg1NDE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA1MzkxOTAxN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODgyMTg1NDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A hard-working small business owner and his two associates travel to Europe to close the most important deal of their lives. But what began as a routine business trip goes off the rails in every imaginable - and unimaginable - way, including unplanned stops at a massive sex fetish event and a global economic summit.
"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000681/","name":"Vince Vaughn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2002649/","name":"Dave Franco"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0929489/","name":"Tom Wilkinson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0779433/","name":"Ken Scott"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007127/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007127/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035535/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0175726/","name":"Steve Conrad"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

Killing Gunther
programme.desc: Killing Gunther: Directed by Taran Killam. With Taran Killam, Dave 'Squatch' Ward, Bobby Moynihan, Hannah Simone. A group of eccentric assassins are fed up with Gunther, the world's greatest hitman, and decide to kill him, but their plan turns into a series of bungled encounters as Gunther seems to always be one step ahead." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5689068/","name":"Killing Gunther","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgyMjUwNjYxNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTU0NjczMzI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A group of eccentric assassins are fed up with Gunther, the world's greatest hitman, and decide to kill him, but their plan turns into a series of bungled encounters as Gunther seems to always be one step ahead.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5689068/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"krice23"},"dateCreated":"2020-04-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"Enjoy yourself","reviewBody":"A middling movie whose sheer will makes it strangely entertaining.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12908,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Comedy","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2017-09-22","keywords":"funeral,assassin,pregnant woman,documentary style,shooting","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1293859097","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODM0NGE3OTctNTFmOC00ZjY3LWJjYjUtNjBhZGI2MWVmYTYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRzdGFzaWVr._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODM0NGE3OTctNTFmOC00ZjY3LWJjYjUtNjBhZGI2MWVmYTYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRzdGFzaWVr._V1_.jpg","description":"A group of young, raw and undisciplined assassins hire a docu-crew at gun point, to have undeniable proof that they're the ones who will kill the most infamous hitman of all time, Gunther. programme.title: Moonraker
James Bond 007: Moonraker – Streng geheim
programme.desc:
Moonraker: Directed by Lewis Gilbert. With Roger Moore, Lois Chiles, Michael Lonsdale, Richard Kiel. James Bond investigates the mid-air theft of a space shuttle, and discovers a plot to commit global genocide." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0079574/","name":"Moonraker","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2M5MTA3YzUtZDRiNi00NTk4LTk2ODEtY2ZiOTZmMzcwNjQwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDY2MTk1ODk@._V1_.jpg","description":"James Bond investigates the mid-air theft of a space shuttle, and discovers a plot to commit global genocide.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0079574/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"vip_ebriega"},"dateCreated":"2007-02-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Fly me to the moon, Mr. Bond.","reviewBody":"My Take: The comedy is occasionally off, but the special effects and action sequences are terrific. 

Why do some viewers think this entry in the series is by far the weakest of Bond. I beg to differ, I actually think this is one of the better Bonds with Roger Moore. Despite its occasional decline to over-silliness (even for Bond standards), I actually find it more entertaining than Roger Moore's early entry "The Man with the Golden Gun". 

The plot, which is more like a variation of THE SPY WHO LOVED ME and YOU ONLY LIVE TWICE (only a little sillier), involves the theft of the Moonraker space shuttles. 007 is sent to Drax Industries, the manufacturers or these shuttles. He soon discovers that the owner, Hugo Drax (Michael Lonsdale) uses this rockets to fulfill his dastardly plans to create another civilization. 

One of the main reasons that critics mistreat this Bond entry is because it doesn't go with the trend of the other Bonds. MOONRAKER tries to be more faithful to the then-popular trend of science fiction movies (after the enduring success of such classic as STAR WARS and CLOSE ENCOUNTERS). Another would be its occasion to go beyond the level of silliness and not knowing when to stop. A humorous moment where Bond drives a gondola with wheels is OK, but it's other scenes like Jaws (Richard Kiel) finding a girlfriend are just too silly. More extreme silliness ensues (there are moments of true high-camp standards here), but as long as the sharp wit, the panache and style made famous by many other Bond films are there, there's no real harm in trying something else to go along with it. 

Rating: ***1/2 out of 5.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":95946,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"1979-06-27","keywords":"bad guy turns good,space shuttle,space station,astronaut,official james bond series","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000549/","name":"Roger Moore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001042/","name":"Lois Chiles"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003909/","name":"Michael Lonsdale"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0318150/","name":"Lewis Gilbert"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026336/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054040/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0228970/","name":"Christopher Wood"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001220/","name":"Ian Fleming"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0026755/","name":"Gerry Anderson"}],"duration":"PT2H6M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: For Your Eyes Only
James Bond 007: In tödlicher Mission
programme.desc:
For Your Eyes Only: Directed by John Glen. With Roger Moore, Carole Bouquet, Topol, Lynn-Holly Johnson. James Bond is assigned to find a missing British vessel, equipped with a weapons encryption device and prevent it from falling into enemy hands." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0082398/","name":"For Your Eyes Only","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzQ4YzUzNGQtMDNkYS00NTk5LTkyMDgtNmVkMjg5MjIzNTdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDY2MTk1ODk@._V1_.jpg","description":"James Bond is assigned to find a missing British vessel, equipped with a weapons encryption device and prevent it from falling into enemy hands.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0082398/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ma-cortes"},"dateCreated":"2010-12-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"High adventure and marvelous underwater scenes by debuting filmmaker John Glenn","reviewBody":"Likable Roger Moore in an amazing adventure set on wonderful outdoors located mostly on Greece and Greek islands . This is a Bond's good entry in which faces dangerous adventures around the world . Moore's outing with overwhelming action and spectacular scenarios , the film teams Bond with an archaeologist as endearing ally ( a beautiful Carole Bouquet) in an effort to stop an industrialist from selling a mechanical artifact . After his first introduction in ¨Live and let die¨ as tough and attractive James Bond of the Ian Fleming's famous creation , Roger Moore went on playing various 007 , and ¨ For your eyes only ¨ is one of the best . The picture starts with an overblown opening , the best part of this film in which James Bond reckoning to Blofield (in previous entries played by Donald Plesance and Charles Gray , but here doesn't appear his face) . This thrilling film deals about seductive James Bond as the ultimate spy hero who is assigned by MI6 a dangerous mission to recover an important device that control over British Polaris nuclear subs . As Bond joins the search, he suspects the tough Colombo (Topol as a gregarious smuggler) and the suave Kristatos (Julian Glover) of seizing the powerful system. Bond finds an ally in the gorgeous Melina Havelock (Carol Bouquet) , who blames Colombo for the death of her parents (Jack Hedley) . Meanwhile , Bond goes to a ski station , there happens a high-octane race and Bond discovers some clues and confronting hoodlums (Michael Gothard ,Charles Dance). James is double-crossed and continues to follow the lead , deciding to investigate on the Egean sea . Following the tracks all lead a nasty billionaire , a maniacal villain who schemes the selling of the powerful machine to a Russian general (Walter Goetell).

This solid , slick thriller with magic mix of action-packed , dazzling stunts, gadgetry, and romance provided by sexy company as Carol Bouquet, Lynn Holly Johnson and Cassandra Harris (first wife of Pierce Brosnan until her death) . Roger Moore as James Bond is fine , he does remarkably well , he earns in irony, humor ,suavity and sympathy, however also has coldness ,cunning , intelligence and toughness . Here Bond is an efficient , relentless agent trying to chase obstinately the criminals , traveling around the world as always , as this globe-trotting story is set in Spain , Veneto ,Italia and Greece at Meteoro mountains and Corfu islands . Bond to achieve his aims , along the way uses violent means even pulling off brutal killings against enemies who wreak all sorts of havoc . As always Bond will use fantastic gadgets and spectacular cars (here a Lotus) provided by ¨Q¨ (Desmond Llewelyn) . In addition , there appears the usual as Lois Maxwell, ¨MoneyPenny¨ , Minister of Defense as Geoffrey Keen and Walter Goetell as Russian general .

The picture contains comic-strip adventure , sensational pursuits , silly set pieces, great stunts, tongue-in check humor, automovile chase, frantic unstopped action , an impressive tour over razor-sharp coral reefs, amazing gimmicks and stimulating images like are the happenings on the spectacular pursuits on the snow, the overwhelming underwater scenes, and the breathtaking battles . As is like a roller-coaster , as is fast-paced, light, excitement, funny and entertaining ; it's a winner for oo7 fans and non-fans alike . The chase and suspense formula wears strong in this entry .The action-packed includes , exciting underwater fights, and cliffhanging assault of a rousing mountaintop fortress filmed in Meteoro monastery .Enjoyable title song by Sheena Easton and stirring musical score fitting to action by Bill Conti (Rocky saga's composer) ,following the John Barry's classic style . Riveting and fancy main titles by habitual Maurice Binder , furthermore eye-popping production design by Peter Lamont. It's brimming with colorful and fascinating cinematography by cameraman Alan Hume . The motion picture produced by habitual producers, Albert R Broccoli and Michael G. Wilson , being professionally made by John Glenn who filmed various outings and previously directed 2nd unit and edition on some early Bond movies . He directed several entries as ¨Licence to kill, A view to kill , For your eyes only and Octopussy¨ though with no much originality . Debuting John Glenn keeps this moving at an incredibly fast pace and this story about every's favorite super-spy falling in love with an archaeologist is one of author Ian Fleming's best . The film will appeal to James Bond series's buffs but good for fans only ; because this one goes on far too long and has provoked so much debate among 007 followers . Rating : 6'5 , well worth watching .","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":96664,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Adventure","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1981-06-25","keywords":"cortina italy,007,albania,blofeld's cat,official bond film","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"For Your Eyes Only","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi123601433","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjM3ZGZiMzctNjNhZC00YWVmLTkyZWYtNmM2MTUxZTg1YTYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjM3ZGZiMzctNjNhZC00YWVmLTkyZWYtNmM2MTUxZTg1YTYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for this James Bond classic"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000549/","name":"Roger Moore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000962/","name":"Carole Bouquet"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0867694/","name":"Topol"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0322515/","name":"John Glen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054040/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0537363/","name":"Richard Maibaum"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0933865/","name":"Michael G.
